Very well. Here's a bottle of Cyrodilic brandy for your cult's fund-raising dinner, with my compliments and best wishes.
You do that.
You don't have five ceramic bowls. So you won't be juggling five ceramic bowls. Am I going too fast for you?
You want to perform? What are you going to do?
You've already entertained our patrons. Wait until tomorrow.
A ship wrecked off Azura's coast over a year ago. I need someone to find the wreckage of the Prelude.

As I said, thieves have broken into his shop three nights in a row. I suspect they will try again tonight. His shop is in the Plaza of the Foreign Quarter here in Vivec. Go there and kill any thieves that arrive.
Back already? I hope Tarvyn Faren made it safely to Pelagiad.
Bandits are always bad for business. Because of bandits on the road to Pelagiad, the Hlaalu trader Tarvyn Faren needs an escort.
Did you catch the thief that's been bothering Ralen Tilvur?
Did you deliver the sealed report as I asked?
Did you find out what was going on at Odirniran?
Did you find the Prelude? Do you have my wakizashi?
Did you get Murudius Flaeus' debt money?
Do you have the 800 drakes that Murudius Flaeus owes one of our nobles?
Do you have the 800 drakes that Murudius Flaeus owes one of our nobles?
Don't play games with me, %PCName, or I'll send someone to get the money from you the same way I sent you to get the money from Murudius.

Go to Odirniran, on Azura's coast, west of the shrine to Azura and south of the old Dwemer ruins of Nchurdamz. I will mark these ruins on your map. If there are any survivors, ask them what needs to be done. If there are no survivors, take revenge on the foul Telvanni there.
Have you found the Wakizashi?
I doubt the thieves will return soon.
I heard of Ralen Tilvur's death. I believe you are the one that killed him. I do not believe we have any more business to discuss.
I heard that Tarvyn Faren did not arrive safely. I hold you responsible. I will not discuss any more business with you.
I hope you have some good news about the ebony trade.
I just gave you a key. Go to Yngling Half_Troll's basement and kill the blighted rats. Try and leave the healthy rats alone.
I need someone to collect a debt from Murudius Flaeus.
I wonder if Yngling's rats will win this week in the Arena?
I'm glad Tarvyn Faren arrived safely. Take these 500 drakes for helping House Hlaalu's business.
I'm glad to hear that the Telvanni threat in Odirniran has ended. Please take these 500 drakes for a job well done.
I'm glad you delivered the report, but you should not have opened it. That kind of unreliability is why I must send all my messages in code.
I'm glad you were able to get that report to Baren Alen in time. Here, take these 50 drakes for your trouble.
It's business as usual in Vivec. Speak with Crassius Curio at his manor here in the Hlaalu Compound or speak with Nileno Dorvayn in Balmora.
It's in the Plaza of the St. Olms Canton, near the statue. St. Olms is southeast of here, just south of the Arena.
It's not far from here. Just leave my house and go north. The Treasury connects to the vaults, the prison, and the records office.
Like I said, deliver the sealed report to Baren Alen at the Hlaalu Treasury.
Meet Tarvyn Faren on the road to Pelagiad, near the Silt Strider just north of the bridge to the Foreign Quarter. Escort him safely to Pelagiad.

Murudius Flaeus owes a House Hlaalu noble over 800 drakes in gambling debts. He lives in Hla Oad. Go there and get the drakes from him. If he refuses to give you the money, you can kill him, but if you get the money, you can keep half of it.
No, %PCName, I don't believe we've met. My name is Edryno Arethi. I don't have any official title, but I handle House Hlaalu's business here in Vivec.
Not business today, but duty. House Hlaalu sent a team to an illegal Telvanni base, but they have not returned from Odirniran.
Ralen Tilvur is dead? I suppose the thief killed him, then. I may have other business for you.
Ralen Tilvur told me that you let the thief escape. Perhaps you are not as loyal to House Hlaalu as I thought.
So what did you do about the game rats?
So you killed him? Good work, but I can't pay you if you didn't find the debt money.
Take this sealed report to Baren Alen, the clerk of the Hlaalu Treasury in Vivec.
Thank you for protecting Ralen Tilvur. Take these 1000 drakes as a reward from House Hlaalu.
Thanks to you, the Empire must still buy all its ebony from House Hlaalu. Take these 1000 drakes as a share of House Hlaalu's future profits.
The business of Vvardenfell is the ebony trade.
The ebony trade is going well thanks to you, %PCName.

The ship was trying to land at a secret dock and is likely to be hard to find. I believe they crashed on an island east of Bal Fell. Start there, head due east, and look around the islands you pass. It should be within two or three islands of Bal Fell. The ship was carrying a Daedric Wakizashi when it sank. Bring that Wakizashi to me. You can keep anything else you find there.
The Zainab camp, is southwest of Vos in the Grazelands region. I will mark it on your map since it is easy to get lost in the Grazelands.
The Zainab have been trying to sell ebony. Go speak with the Zainab camp and make sure they only sell ebony through us.
Then do not waste my time. Go to Hla Oad and get Murudius Flaeus to pay the money.
There is no more Telvanni threat in Odirniran.
There's been alot of merchants around here killed recently. I hope the guards catch whoever is responsible.
Thieves have broken into a shop here in Vivec three nights in a row. I need someone to defend Ralen Tilvur's shop.
Today's business involves Yngling Half-Troll's prized game rats.
What can I do for you today, %PCName?
What? Are you saying that Baren Alen is dead? This is a major blow to House Hlaalu. I am not sure what kinds of business I can give you now that he's dead.
Yes, it's all here. I hope Murudius Flaeus wasn't too much trouble. You get to keep half of it, like we agreed.
Yes, of course, I need a courier to deliver this sealed report.
Yes, this is the one. Here, take these 500 drakes as a finders fee.
Ynging just told me you cured the blighted rats. Since you also spared the game rats, Yngling told me to pay you 1000 drakes.
Ynging just told me you killed the blighted rats. Since it looks like you spared most of the game rats, Yngling told me to pay you 1000 drakes.

Yngling Half-Troll raises game rats in Yngling Manor here in Vivec. One of his rivals snuck three blighted rats into his breeding pen. Go to Yngling Manor and kill the blighted rats, but spare his prized game rats. The game rats are used to being handled and should ignore you. The blighted rats are wild and should attack you. Here's a key to Yngling's basement.

Yngling is dead? That is news to me. When did it happen? Well, I suppose he had a lot of enemies. I'm sure no one cares about his game rats anymore, and if he's dead, I won't get paid for this. Forget I asked, %PCName. Now I might have other business to discuss...
You already brought me the Wakizashi.
You already delivered the sealed report, %PCName.
You can keep everything else, but that Wakizashi is mine.
You found the Wakizashi? What did you do with it? Bring it here.
You have already dealt with Murudius Flaeus, %PCName.
You have already escorted Tarvyn Faren to Pelagiad.
You killed the blighted rats, but you also killed some of the game rats. Yngling told me to only pay you a token fee of one drake.
You killed the Telvanni and you rescued Vedelea Othril? This was a great service to House Hlaalu. Please take these 1000 drakes for a job well done.
You've already killed the Necromancer in Odirniran? Good work. Take these 500 drakes for anticipating my needs so well.
You've been expelled, %PCName. You need to make amends.
You've been expelled. Go up to the Plaza and talk with Crassius Curio to make amends.
You've been expelled. I cannot discuss business with you unless you make amends.
You've been expelled. I cannot discuss business with you unless you make amends.
You've been expelled. I cannot discuss business with you unless you make amends.
You've been expelled. I cannot discuss business with you unless you make amends.
You've been expelled. I cannot discuss business with you unless you make amends.
You've been expelled. I cannot discuss business with you unless you make amends.
You've been expelled. I cannot discuss business with you unless you make amends.
You've been expelled. I cannot discuss business with you unless you make amends.
You've killed some of the Zainab? Hm. I don't think they will deal with you now. We'll need to send someone else to trade with them.

I see you've found them. Very, well, I admit it. I stole them under contract with the Thieves Guild. Odral Helvi has abused his power and made many enemies. Flatter him a bit, make up some story about where you found the contracts, and I'll put in a good word for you with my Guild and with House Hlaalu.
I've given you the key. Take the documents back to Odral, but don't tell him that it was me, all right? Just make up some story.

Okay, I confess. I stole them under contract with the Thieves Guild. They are in the chest on my windowsill. Here is the key. Odral Helvi has abused his power and made many enemies. Flatter him a bit, make up some story about where you found the contracts, and I'll put in a good word for you with my Guild and with House Hlaalu.
Thanks, %PCName.
That's me. What do you want?

They're just lackeys for the Camonna Tong. Orvas Dren runs the show. The Thieves Guild is fighting for its life against House Hlaalu, and here you are helping them with their business... Now not everyone in House Hlaalu is against us, but Odral Helvi sure is.
Why are you asking me? You have no proof.

Yes, I stole them, %PCRank. Guild business. If you turn me in, you'll lose standing with the Guild. The documents are in that chest on my windowsill. Here is the key. Tell Odral that you just found the documents lying around. That fool will believe anything if you flatter him enough.
Beneath Red Mountain, Lord Dagoth sleeps. But when he wakes, we all shall rise, and the dust will blow away. Serve your Lord, Dagoth Ur. The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory.

Do you mean... have I been... under a spell? A curse? And this was caused by Sixth House cultists? Good grief. What have I done... I hope... but I haven't thanked you. Please forgive me. I have nothing to offer but my thanks. But I will tell everyone I know how you have saved my life.

Do you mean... have I been... under a spell? A curse? And this was caused by Sixth House cultists? Good grief. What have I done... I hope... but I haven't thanked you. Please forgive me. I have nothing to offer but my thanks. But I will tell everyone I know how you have saved my life.

He is the Lord, and Father of the Mountain. He sleeps, but when he wakes, we shall rise from our dreams, shall sweep our land clean of the n'wah. Why have you denied him? As Lord Dagoth has said. 'All shall greet him as flesh, or as dust.'
I am a Sleeper, one among thousands. I bring you a message. Dagoth Ur calls you, %PCName, and you cannot deny your Lord. The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory.
I feel as though I've just awakened from a dream... a terrible dream of the Sixth House.
I feel as though I've just awakened from a dream... a terrible dream of the Sixth House.
It is the Hour of Wakening. He comes forth in his glory, and his people shall rejoice, and his enemies shall scatter like dust.
Thank you again. I will tell everyone I know how you have saved my life.
Thank you again. I will tell everyone I know how you have saved my life.
The Devil Dagoth Ur is dead, and all his kin. And the Blight has gone, too, and the skies are blue over Red Mountain.
The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. You have defied my Lord Dagoth, and his judgement is death. Flee, and hide, or die where you stand.

The Sixth House, the Sleeping House, House Dagoth, the House of Lord Dagoth. The true house, the one house to welcome all true Dunmer, and drive the n'wah from our land. Rejoice, and join us. Come to Red Mountain, and prepare the way for his coming.

The Sixth House, the Sleeping House, House Dagoth, the House of Lord Dagoth. The true house, the one house to welcome all true Dunmer, and drive the n'wah from our land. Take heed, outlander. The day of reckoning is at hand. Take what you can, and leave our place, for when Lord Dagoth comes, this will be no place for you.
The slave and foreigner, beast and man, all must die. All mer must accept our dominion, or flee our wrath.
The wickwheat is winnowed, and under the harrow, the earth is prepared for planting. The n'wah must die, and their flesh serve to sweeten the soil.
You, foreigner! You must die. Beasts and men, outlander mer, all must die. Flee his wrath and quit this land, if you would live, or your flesh shall feed the earth.
Odral Helvi wants to set up a netch ranch of his own in the Ascadian Isles, but none of the farmers are selling.
Lately the Ordinators have been taking verbal shots at the Legion guards. The Legion brass has got a muzzle on the troops, but they don't like it one bit.
Whatever it is, it can wait for another day. Goodbye.
You're time has come, %PCRace!
Drerel...dead? No! This cannot be happening. It can't be true. Please...leave me.
I can only pray those hounds don't return before my husband has returned.
My husband Drerel is dead? No! I can't speak about this anymore.
Please, can you help me? My husband and I were traveling through here, and we were attacked by a pack of wild nix hounds.

There were at least three of them; they seemed to come out of nowhere. My husband, Drerel Indaren tried to fight them off, but the were too much for him, and he was forced to flee. I tried to play dead, in hopes the hounds would find no sport in me. I just hope I can find Drerel before the hounds come back.
Well, hopefully, he'll find his way back, and the nix hounds won't come back for me. Take care, stranger.

You're willing to do that? Thank you so much! I'm sure he didn't go too far, because the hounds seemed to have hurt him. If I remember correctly, he ran off to the west, but in all the confusion, I can't be sure.
You already know. Hrundi and I are lovers. When he saves up enough money, we're going to move far, far away from here.
You don't work for Sjoring Hard-Heart, do you? Okay, then, I'll admit it. Hrundi and I are lovers.
You're asking the wrong girl. Leave me alone. There's nothing going on between Hrundi and me.
[Falura Llervu looks down at the ground waiting for you to speak.]
[The slave looks down at the ground waiting for you to speak.]

Are we ready to travel together to Zainab camp? Do not worry if we must cross water, for I am an excellent swimmer. But take care to protect me from wild beasts and bandits, for I have not learned any of the arts of war. I do know a few spells, but they the spells of a household slave, and will probably be of little use if we are in danger. So. Shall we go now?
Are you ready now for me to accompany you to Zainab camp?
But, first, didn't you have some presents for me?
He is very distinguished-looking, isn't he? A bit severe, perhaps, but the lines on his face, there, show that he likes to smile. Oh, sera. I think I will be very happy.

I admit, I am a little anxious about marrying an Ashlander, even an Ashlander chief, but anything is better than being a slave, and I am very tough and smart, and determined to make the best of my chances. But Savile Imayn said you wanted to give me something. Some presents....
I am Falura Llervu, bride of the Ashkhan Kaushad of the Zainab Ashlanders.
I am yours. Now I cannot wait to meet my bridegroom.
I'm sure she said you had some presents for me. She said you would give them to me before we leave for Zainab camp to meet my bridegroom.
It was quite a journey, wasn't it?
My name is Falura Llervu, sera. If you wish to purchase me, you must speak to Savile Imayn.

My name is Falura Llervu. Savile Imayn has told me that you plan for me to marry an Ashlander lord. Savile Imayn has taught me what to say and do, and I would be very happy to do this thing. All that remains is for you to purchase me.

Oh, sera! These clothes! They are divine! Such a perfume! Only the very rich can afford this! I shall do everything I can to please you and my new master... that is, my gracious lord and husband-to-be. Come! I am so excited, I cannot wait! Let us travel together to Zainab camp and meet this Zainab lord.

Thank you, sera. I am very pleased with Ashkhan Kaushad. He is good-looking, clever, and rich, although a bit full of himself, like all men. Thank you for being my matchmaker and benefactor, and I hope you will return to visit when I have brought many fine sons and daughters to Ashkhan Kaushad.
Very well, %PCName. Now you and I will travel together. When we have arrived in the ashkhan's yurt at Zainab camp, we will speak further about my new bridegroom.
Very well, %PCName. Now you and I will travel together. When we have arrived in the ashkhan's yurt at Zainab camp, we will speak further about my new bridegroom.
Very well, %PCName. Now you and I will travel together. When we have arrived in the ashkhan's yurt at Zainab camp, we will speak further about my new bridegroom.
Very well, then. I will wait here for now.
Very well, then. I will wait here for now.
Very well, then. I will wait here for now. When you are ready, come to me, and I will travel together with you to Zainab camp to meet my new bridegroom.
We travel together to Zainab camp. When we arrive there, we will speak further about my new bridegroom. Do you wish me to continue accompanying you?
Yes, %PCName. Are you ready now to travel together to Zainab camp?
Yes, %PCName. We travel together to Zainab camp. When we arrive there, we will speak further about my new bridegroom.

Yes, Nerevarine. I am very happy. And I think Kaushad is happy with his bride. I hope soon to bear Kaushad many fine sons and daughters, and I think our first-born should bear your name, if the spirits are willing.

Yes, sera. Falura Llervu of Velothis Haven, daughter of Andrano Llervu, lord of Tel Llervu, pleased to make your acquaintance. See? Savile Imayn has taught me well. I shall BE a high-born Telvanni lady, and no one will know the difference. Just like a lady.
Yes, sera?
Yes, thank you, sera. He is a very fine man, and I am very happy.
Yes, yes, sera. Yes, we are here safely. And this fine man, he is to be my bridegroom?
You are the Nerevarine? But... you are an outlander. How can that be? Such wonders in the world. Before, I was a slave; now I am a companion of the Nerevarine and the bride of a Zainab chief.
Before I give you more duties, you must build a stronghold and expand your stronghold.

By killing Meril Hlaano, you have certainly prevented him from continuing his slanders, but this action has cost House Redoran much honor. But I must not blame you as you are an outlander and you cannot understand such things.
Dagoth Tanis is dead.
Did you convince Rothis Nethan to appear for the duel?
Do you have the treasures of the Redas Tomb?
Do you want the family treasures, %PCRank?
Go speak with Llerar Mandas in the Grand Council Chambers in Ebonheart.. He can tell you more.

Go to the Redas Ancestral Tomb and  bring me the Redas War Axe, the Redas Chalice, and the Redas Robe of Deeds. The tomb is just south of Molag Mar, but you'll have to go around the mountains. I'd suggest following the mountains west and then following them back east. The tomb is in the side of the mountain, near an ashlander camp.

Good. It is a shame that Irer Nervion died, but Dagoth Tanis is dead, and you have returned his ancestor ring. Do you have an ancestor ring of your own? Although you are an outlander, I will give you one of my own family's ancestor rings. May Almalexia show you and your ancestors mercy.
Good. You are doing well. Speak to me again when you want more duties.
Have you convinced Meril Hlaano to stop his slanders against our House?
Have you slain Dagoth Tanis?
Here. Take them, %PCRank. You have certainly earned the right to keep them.
I am Faral Retheran. The House Redoran steward here in Vivec.
I believe Rothis Nethan is hiding out at the Flowers of Gold Cornerclub in the Redoran Waistworks here in Vivec. Go talk to him, and make him realize how this has cost the honor of House Redoran.
I do not have any duties for you, %PCRank. Speak with me again when you are a Brother in House Redoran.
I do not see his ancestor's ring. Are you sure you did not misplace it?
I have no time for those who have betrayed House Redoran.
I heard you were expelled, %PCName. You must make amends.
I heard you were expelled, %PCName. You need to make amends.
I hope you will never shame House Redoran by failing to appear for a duel.
Is Telvanni Reynel Uvirith dead?
Is the Hlaalu lord Raynasa Rethan dead?
It is a shame that you had to kill Arethan Mandas, but at least Delyna is now safe.
It was very kind of you to help Arethan Mandas by rescuing his daughter. Make sure you tell Llerar Mandas that his granddaughter is safe.
May Vivec guide your hand when you use the Redas treasures.
Meril Hlaano has withdrawn his slanderous statements against our House. Please accept this shield as a reward.
Nalvilie... Now that's a name I haven't heard in years. I heard she's had some hard times after she lost her youth and beauty.
No, you are a traitor to House Redoran. If you have nothing important to discuss, you should leave.
Rethan Manor is on the Odai Plateau, on the River Odai which heads south from Balmora. Go there and slay Raynasa Rethan. Show these Hlaalu that we mean business.
Reynel Uvirith is already dead? You understand the politics of the situation well, %PCName. Maybe even the Telvanni will think twice about expanding illegally.
Reynel Uvirith is dead. Tel Uvirith will not be a threat unless some other Telvanni moves in.

Rothis Nethan failed to appear for a duel of honor with Brethas Deras, a Hlaalu noble. This has shamed House Redoran. Track down the craven Rothis Nethan here in the Redoran Canton and persuade him to attend the duel.
So Raynasa Rethan is already dead. Good work, %PCName.
So Rethan Manor now has no Hlaalu lord. Good work, %PCName.
So you were able to convince Rothis Nethan at last. I hope he will appear for the duel this time. Meet him in the arena and watch the outcome of this duel.
Speak with Llerar Mandas. He is the father of Arethan Mandas.
That is a shame. I suppose we will never know what happened to him. Still, Dagoth Tanis is dead, and that is a cause for celebration.
That is very disappointing, %PCName.
The abandoned stronghold of Falasmaryon in Maar Gan has been taken over by a creature known as Dagoth Tanis.
The duel is over and House Redoran's honor is saved.
The Hlaalu have also been expanding, and at a more alarming rate. Go to Rethan Manor and kill the new Hlaalu Lord Raynasa Rethan.
The Hlaalu will have a hard time doing business there with Raynasa Rethan gone.
The last of the Redas family line has bequeathed the family's belongings to House Redoran. I need someone to recover the family treasures from the Redas Tomb.
The matter is closed.

The so-called 'Tel Uvirith' is built on Uvirith's grave, which can be found west of Tel Fyr and northwest of the Erabenimsun camp. Go there and make sure the Telvanni understand that we will not tolerate this illegal expansion.
The son of a Hlaalu noble has slandered House Redoran. Find Meril Hlaano in Balmora and demand that he withdraw the slander.

The stronghold of Falasmaryon is just northeast of Maar Gan, across the Foyada Bani-Dad. You can get into the Foyada east of Maar Gan. Go there and slay Dagoth Tanis. We sent the Buoyant Armiger, Irer Nervion, to Falasmaryon, but he has not returned. If he is dead, bring back his ancestor ring, so that I can return it to his family.
The Telvanni have begun expanding all over Vvardenfell. This must be stopped. Go to the new Telvanni stronghold of Tel Uvirith and kill the Telvanni Sorcerer Reynel Uvirith.
Then I shall keep them safe.
Well, if Brethas Deras is already dead, the duel cannot take place.
Well, if Rothis Nethan is already dead, the duel cannot take place.
What can I do for you, %PCName?
What can I do for you, %PCName? Are you interested in duties for House Redoran? I may have a few.
What can I do for you, %PCRank?
Yes, %PCName. You have all three of the treasures. Will you give them to me now?
Yes, Reynel Uvirith is dead. This will send those Telvanni a message.
You are the %PCRank now, and I should not be giving you duties.
You broke our rules and have been expelled. You must make amends before I can give you duties.
You can find Meril Hlaano at the Eight Plates in Balmora. Speak with him and make him withdraw the slander.
You have already returned the treasures.
You have been expelled, %PCName, and must make amends.
You have performed all the duties I have, %PCRank.
You have slain Dagoth Tanis? Did you find Irer Nervion? Or do you have his ancestor ring?
You rescued Delyna Mandas? Good. I hope this will help cure Arethan Mandas of his madness. Make sure you tell Llerar Mandas that his granddaughter is safe.
You've been expelled from House Redoran. Make amends if you can.
You've been expelled from House Redoran. Make amends if you can.

Excellent! It sounded like there was a fight going on in there, and from the looks of you, it seems you got the worst of it. No matter. I thank you for your efforts. Here, take this. I think it will help even your kind.
Greetings, Child Killer. I assume you have come here because of my son.
Hello again, vampire. Have you convinced my son?

I assumed you had heard the talk about town. Well, there's no harm in telling you now. He wishes to join you in your undead existence. He thinks this will give him the power and respect accorded him. Foolish boy. Maybe you can work with me, vampire. Show my son that your kind is not all-powerful. Convince him you have weaknesses. I have treasures even one of your kind must covet.
I have no interest in spreading rumors.
I will not have my son becoming one of your kind.
Leave here now, vampire. I don't want my son to get any further ideas.
Murderer! Child killer! Begone foul creature!
No? I should have expected as much. Leave here, vampire. Leave my family alone.
What is it you want, vampire? Have you convinced my son of the error in his thinking?

You will? Interesting. I wish you luck in your attempt, dark one. Maybe your words can succeed where mine could not. You will find my son here in the house, just a few rooms away from here. Unless you show him that vampires are not as strong as he believes them to be, I fear for his life. Find a way to show him this, vampire.
I have some things to do here in town, but I will come visit Indarys Manor as soon as I can.
I understand what you're asking, and I'm not offended. But I'm not sure I should leave Ald'ruhn.
I'm sorry, but I'm confused. I don't think I will ever understand what you're asking.
No, I'm sorry, but I just don't understand at all. You'll have to find someone else to be your friend's wife. If that's what you wanted.
Okay. I agree. Just let me take care of a few things here in town, and I'll pay a visit to Indarys Manor.
Wait. If I understand you, you're saying that this 'Indarys Manor' has a dozen eligible men. And there are only a few women there. And you want me to move there to find a husband, right?
What? Why would I leave here with a complete stranger to marry a man I've never met?
Yes, you were right. These men need wives. Have you seen how they dress? Perhaps I will stay here a few days.
I do not have any duties for you. Perhaps you could speak with Endryn Llethan in Ald'ruhn or Tharer Rotheloth in Molag Mar.
Did you bring Mistress Therana her new clothes?
First go to Tel Branora. Then head north up the small peninsula. Cross to the next island to the northwest. The mine is on the northern corner of that island.
First, you must set a Mark. Then you can use Recall to return to that Mark at any time. [Felisa teaches you how to cast these spells.]
Have you put down the slave rebellion?
I am Felisa Ulessen, the Mouth for Mistress Therana.
I do not have any chores for you. Speak with the other Mouths if you need chores. Or you could speak with Mistress Therana again, though I would not recommend it.
I do not have anything else for you to deliver to Mistress Therana.
I don't think so. Not even as a joke. No. Definitely. Not funny.
I gave you the skirt. Deliver it to Mistress Therana in Tel Branora. You have to deliver it to her personally, not just put it somewhere in Tel Branora.
I know Mistress Therana can be difficult. If you have any trouble, just use the scroll I gave you.
I trust you did not have any trouble... Well, in any case, I owe you 500 drakes for the delivery. Perhaps I could also teach you how to Mark and Recall if you don't know how already.
Isn't that a special champion and war leader among the Great Houses?
Mistress Therana has requested that someone deliver her new clothes to her. I will pay 1000 drakes to anyone willing to deliver her new clothes.
Mistress Therana is an... unwise choice for a patron.
Mistress Therana is concerned about a slave rebellion in one of her holdings.
She is my patron in House Telvanni, and I am her Mouth. She can be... difficult at times. Be very careful if you must speak with her.
So be it. [Felisa teaches you spells of command.] May your slaves be more obedient.

Take this skirt and deliver it to Mistress Therana. She lives in Tel Branora and can be... eccentric at times. Take these ALMSIVI Intervention scrolls. Don't hesitate to use them if Therana becomes... difficult.
Tel Branora is Therana's tower. It's near the southeast tip of Azura's Coast on an island. I will mark it on your map. I believe you can take a boat there. That's probably the best way.
The leader of this rebellion is dead? Very good. Mistress Therana asked me to give you this ring if you killed the leader.
The rebellious slaves are dead? Very good. Mistress Therana asked me to give you these if you killed the slaves.
The slave rebellion is no more.
The slaves have revolted in the Abebaal Egg Mine. Go there and put an end to this rebellion before it spread to Mistress Therana's other holdings.

Well. I don't remember, exactly. But I'm fairly sure that all the Telvanni councilors must vote to choose a Hortator, and the vote must be unanimous. Since a Hortator's duty is to lead a Great House in war, it stands to reason that the candidate would have to know something about war.

You say the slaves have escaped? Hm. I suppose I will have to hire someone else to track them down. If you ever have holdings of your own, you'll want to be able to command them forcefully. I can teach you a spell that might help with this if you want.

You'll have to speak directly to Mistress Therana about this. Her tower, Tel Branora, is south of Sadrith Mora, on the southeast point of Azura's Coast, on a long peninsula. There's no convenient way to get there. I must also warn you. Mistress Therana is very eccentric. It is often hard to get and keep her attention. You'll do better if you try and keep her happy, and not distract her with long arguments.
Your choice, %PCName.
Your choice, %PCName.
I am a netch herder. It's long hours, but easy work. Just keep them from wandering off.
Just a friendly warning. Don't spook the netch. Don't worry -- they're completely safe if you don't bother them -- but get them riled up, and they're trouble. Especially the betty netch.

Normally a single betty netch will have a harem of five or six bull netch, but we keep the bull-betty ration closer to one-to-one for faster breeding. Tends to make our betty netch a little more aggressive than they are in the wild.
Remember. Leave the netch alone, and they'll leave you alone.
The betty netch is the tough one. It's the bull netch that's poisonous, but the betty netch is twice as tough and twice as mean.
Good day, outlander. I'm the caravaner for Suran. Tell me your destination, and I'll tell you if I can help you.
I can carry you by silt strider from Suran to Vivec, Molag Mar, Balmora, and Seyda Neen.

This is the silt strider port for the town of Suran, outlander, in the Ascadian Isles region. I'm a caravaner, and I manage the silt strider port here. Tell me your destination, if you're looking for a ride. Or if you're new to Suran, I can help you with local services, or any specific place in Suran you're looking for. Or if you want someone in particular, maybe I know where to look.
You looking for a silt strider? What's your destination?

Alright, I'll tell you just one thing. I saw Nads Tharen talking with Arvama Rathri the last day he was here. Haven't seen him in a while, though. Check over in St. Delyn canton, South Side canalworks. That's where he lives.
I didn't see a thing. What my customers do is there own business.
I don't care who you are. If you ever do anything like that in my club again, you'll be sorry.
I don't talk about my customers, but for you I'll make an exception. Don't get involved with her. Don't even talk to her. Just leave and don't look back.
I don't talk about my customers.
I really couldn't say.
Odral Helvi's up to no good. He's the most corrupt fatcat in all of Caldera.
Sarayn Sadus fled from Vivec. I heard the Morag Tong has a writ on him.
So that's settled then.
The Morag Tong will pay for this insult!
What are you doing here?

Welcome to our little Almsivi chapel. Pardon our informal surroundings, but we are guests here of House Telvanni, and apparently they have no more spacious, well-lit accommodations available for the Temple faithful. Still, we have all the services you'd expect to find a much larger Temple.
Yes? What can I do for you?

Almalexia's homilies are full of compassion, understanding, wisdom and acceptance. But now her sermons seem more intent on destroying the wicked, punishing the foolish, and rewarding the faithful -- the unquestioning, obedient faithful. Yes, these are difficult times. And in difficult times, to survive, we must be hard. I tremble for the failing of my faith... but the god I once loved now frightens me.

Almalexia's homilies are full of compassion, understanding, wisdom and acceptance. But now her sermons seem more intent on destroying the wicked, punishing the foolish, and rewarding the faithful -- the unquestioning, obedient faithful. Yes, these are difficult times. And in difficult times, to survive, we must be hard. I tremble for the failing of my faith... but the god I once loved now frightens me.

Helseth has murdered King Llethan and stolen his crown. It does not matter that King Llethan was a fool. He was OUR fool. So long as the puppet king was a joke, we all could laugh and ignore him. Helseth is not a fool, and no one is laughing. If Helseth seeks in earnest to be king, then Almalexia and the Temple are sworn in earnest to destroy him.

I am a faithful believer.... but Almalexia makes me uneasy. For the last 50 years, the Tribunal stopped walking among us, stopped listening and speaking with us. This worried me, and made me sad. Were our gods abandoning us? Were they growing weak? But since Almalexia has lately come among us again, I feel more worry, not less. Her face glows brightly with hope and power, but her words seem dark and bitter.

I am a faithful believer.... but Almalexia makes me uneasy. For the last 50 years, the Tribunal stopped walking among us, stopped listening and speaking with us. This worried me, and made me sad. Were our gods abandoning us? Were they growing weak? But since Almalexia has lately come among us again, I feel more worry, not less. Her face glows brightly with hope and power, but her words seem dark and bitter.

I've heard some of the high priests of the Temple are going to be relocated. I haven't heard who or where, or why, but it seems to be a result of some serious disagreement about Temple doctrine between the Alma Rula and some outspoken critics.

I've heard that a group of Temple priests plan to reform the Temple, to restore the ancient worship of the ancestors -- and the good Daedra in particular. I think the idea is to worship Almalexia, Sotha Sil, and Vivec more like saints than like gods -- the way Saint Nerevar is worshipped. They say the war with Dagoth Ur has exhausted the Tribunal, and they wish to retire. Since they haven't appeared publicly in so long, the Temple wouldn't be so different, really.

The Dissident priests dispute Temple doctrine. They challenge the purity and divinity of the Tribunal, suggesting their powers are sorcerous, not divine. They also condemn the arbitrary power of the Ordinators, and accuse the Temple hierarchy of self-interest and corruption. The Dissident Priests are outlawed and persecuted by the Temple.

These are difficult times. Everyone says so. But we are told, 'Count only the happy hours.' I am a faithful follower of the Tribunal, and I believe in the Seven Graces and the Seven Virtues. Yet.... No. You must excuse me. You are a stranger, and one does not share ones doubts with strangers.
What? Why do you ask me this? This is a mistake. You are a stranger, and one does not share ones doubts with strangers. I don't want to talk about this with you.

Yes, you may come again another time. It is hard to talk of such things. I feel guilty, and disloyal, but in my heart, I know something is not right. It helps a little to be able to speak of it with you.

Yes, you may come again another time. It is hard to talk of such things. I feel guilty, and disloyal, but in my heart, I know something is not right. It helps a little to be able to speak of it with you.

You are a friend of Mehra Milo? Then I can speak freely. Helseth has murdered King Llethan and stolen his crown. It does not matter that King Llethan was a fool. He was OUR fool. So long as the puppet king was a joke, we all could laugh and ignore him. Helseth is not a fool, and no one is laughing. If Helseth seeks in earnest to be king, then Almalexia and the Temple are sworn in earnest to destroy him.

Your story is unbelievable. But... rumors here say Almalexia is no longer in Mournhold, and she plans to be gone indefinitely. They say she exhausted her body and spirit in the war against Dagoth Ur, but now she plans to travel in disguise among the people, living the life of a mortal, and recovering her love for the world. The Temple plans to keep this a secret, for fear of starting a panic among the Faithful. Now... I don't know what to think.

Your story is unbelievable. But... rumors here say Almalexia is no longer in Mournhold, and she plans to be gone indefinitely. They say she exhausted her body and spirit in the war against Dagoth Ur, but now she plans to travel in disguise among the people, living the life of a mortal, and recovering her love for the world. The Temple plans to keep this a secret, for fear of starting a panic among the Faithful. Now... I don't know what to think.

Your story is unbelievable. But... rumors here say Almalexia is no longer in Mournhold, and she plans to be gone indefinitely. They say she exhausted her body and spirit in the war against Dagoth Ur, but now she plans to travel in disguise among the people, living the life of a mortal, and recovering her love for the world. The Temple plans to keep this a secret, for fear of starting a panic among the Faithful. Now... I don't know what to think.

Your story is unbelievable. But... rumors here say Almalexia is no longer in Mournhold, and she plans to be gone indefinitely. They say she exhausted her body and spirit in the war against Dagoth Ur, but now she plans to travel in disguise among the people, living the life of a mortal, and recovering her love for the world. The Temple plans to keep this a secret, for fear of starting a panic among the Faithful. Now... I don't know what to think.

Your story is unbelievable. But... there are rumors here that Almalexia is no longer here in Mournhold, and plans to be gone until Dagoth Ur is defeated. The Temple plans to keep this a secret, for fear of starting a panic among the Faithful. Now... I don't know what to think.

Your story is unbelievable. But... there are rumors here that Almalexia is no longer here in Mournhold, and plans to be gone until Dagoth Ur is defeated. The Temple plans to keep this a secret, for fear of starting a panic among the Faithful. Now... I don't know what to think.

Your story is unbelievable. But... there are rumors here that Almalexia is no longer here in Mournhold, and plans to be gone until Dagoth Ur is defeated. The Temple plans to keep this a secret, for fear of starting a panic among the Faithful. Now... I don't know what to think.

Your story is unbelievable. But... there are rumors here that Almalexia is no longer here in Mournhold, and plans to be gone until Dagoth Ur is defeated. The Temple plans to keep this a secret, for fear of starting a panic among the Faithful. Now... I don't know what to think.
Are you here to discuss your stronghold?
Construction on your stronghold should begin soon. In a week or so, come speak with me again.
Do you have the 5000 drakes and the construction contract?

Here on Vvardenfell, the Duke must issue a construction contract before we lay the first founding stones for any building. This rule is often overlooked by the Hlaalu and Telvanni, but House Redoran is honorable, and I will not break these rules.
I am ready to give you a stronghold fit for a House Redoran Councilor. But first you must speak with Hetman Guls at your stronghold. Ask him what must be done to attract more settlers.
I only offer my services to those who have earned at least the rank of Kinsman.
I oversee the construction of strongholds for House Redoran. Perform your duties and perhaps someday you will need a stronghold of your own.
If you want me to build you a stronghold, I will need 5000 drakes for labor and materials. You must also bring me a construction contract from Duke Dren in Ebonheart.
Indarys Manor will have more settlers soon enough.
It is finished. You have a home to rival that of any House Redoran Councilor.
It is good to hear that the stronghold is progressing well. The work should be finished soon.
Oh, Percius Mercius agreed to garrison your stronghold? Good. I will give the orders to begin the next phase of construction.

So, Hetman Guls believes there should be more women there. I am inclined to agree with him. A stronghold cannot grow and prosper with so few women there. I am spoken for, of course, but if the men at Indarys Manor need wives, there are a few here in town.
So, Hetman Guls is satisfied. I will give the orders to begin the last stage of your stronghold.
The foundations for your stronghold are complete. If you wish to build the next stage of your stronghold, you must hire guards to garrison your stronghold.
The last stage of your stronghold is under construction.
The next stage of your stronghold is under construction.
The second stage of your stronghold is complete. Speak with me again when you need a stronghold fit for a House Redoran Councilor.
There's no need to hire more guards, %PCName.
Without the proper papers and resources, I cannot build your stronghold. I am sure you understand, %PCName.

Yes, %PCName. I want you to make sure your stronghold is being built on schedule. Go to your stronghold, which is being built among the rows of stones, the Bal Isra, on the east side of the road from Ald'ruhn to Maar Gan. Speak with the foreman, Bugdul gro-Kharbush. I will mark it on your map.
Yes, speak with Hetman Guls at your stronghold of Indarys Manor. He can tell you of anything troubling your settlers.
Yes, speak with Percius Mercius at the local Guild of Fighters. They usually know of a few good Redoran fighters out of work.
Yes, the stronghold will be finished soon.
Yes, this is adequate, %PCName. Your stronghold will be built in the Bal Isra on the road to Maar Gan. Construction will begin as soon as I give the orders.
You are no longer a member of House Redoran. If you can make amends, do so. Then we can speak of your stronghold.
You do not have the construction contract. Speak with Duke Dren in Ebonheart. Only he may issue construction contracts.
You have the construction contract, yes, but I must also have 5000 drakes for labor and materials.
You only need one construction contract, %PCName.
Excellent. I appreciate your help. Make sure you don't mention this, though. It could really cause problems for me.

I'm sure I don't know what you're talking about...what makes you think.... All right. I admit it. Business has been slow, though. And that Rernis gets a lot of the business around here. Tell you what: I'll pay you 100 drakes to keep this to yourself. What do you say?
I've said all there is to say about that.
No? This is going to ruin me! My reputation will be destroyed! I hope you're happy with yourself. You'll likely put me out of business.
Continue your work to end slavery here in Morrowind.
He is hiding in some Daedric ruins east of here. Find him and escort him back to town. Make sure the slavehunters do not see him.
I don't know anyone around here you could ask. Try Ald'ruhn instead.
I will send the next slaves we get to your manor. I am sure they will be happier as wives than slaves.
J'Saddha arrived safely.
So, you know the Twin Lamps. We could use your aid in our struggle against slavery.
Thank you for bringing him here. He will have a better life back in his native land. You should report back to Ilmeni Dren that the slave has arrived safely.
Thank you for bringing J'Saddha here safely. You should speak with Ilmeni Dren again.
We have taken him to friends on the mainland. He will return to his homeland.
Yes, I know. You're the lord of Indarys Manor. You said you needed wives there? Why are you asking me? I'm not looking for a husband.

Yes, the slavehunters are Anes Hlaren, Garyn Girith, and Sadal Doren. They have been patrolling in town and near the docks since they heard of J'Saddha's escape. You will need to get rid of them or avoid being seen. Remember it is J'Saddha they are looking for, not you.

You know the Twin Lamps? Well then, yes, we are having some trouble here. A Khajiti slave, J'Saddha, was supposed to meet us at our boat. He sent us a message that he is hiding in some ruins east of here, but there are three slavehunters in town, and we cannot risk being discovered.

You want us to send some of the slaves we get to your manor? Hm. That might work, though I doubt your men want to marry Khajiit or Argonians. I will send you the next suitable slaves that pass through here, but it is up to you to protect them.
She works in the library. If she's not there, you might find her in her private quarters. Her door is across from the Canon Offices here in the Hall of Wisdom.
Goodness. Is he... dead? How unpleasant. Was it very dangerous? I'm sorry. I really have nothing to give you but my thanks. But I'll tell everyone how kind and brave you were to help me.
He's talking to himself. He won't listen to me. He looks very strange. He stares at me funny. And he seems to have lost his shirt. Please. Get him out of there? He's scaring me.
Pardon me. But there's a very strange man in my house, and he won't leave. Will you go get him out of there, please?
Please. Get him out of my house. He's scaring me.
Thank you again for your help.
You are the one who took care of that strange man in my house? Thank you. I'll tell everyone how kind and brave you've been.
I can sneak past.... red eyes won't see me... won't hurt me...

I know you.... you're one of THEM! You can't fool me! Well, you'll never get your hands on it! It's safe from the likes of you! From all you thieves! There's nothing for you here; just get out. GET OUT!
I'll be safe down there.... thieves won't find it... won't find me...
It's safe... too heavy to open. Water will get me past though... just turn the crank....
No, no. No way out. One way in. It's safe. No one can find it.
You again! Gah! I've rid myself of the others; none of you will get it! It's mine, I tell you, all mine!
My husband says he's in Kragenmoor? Old fool. What does he know. He'd forget his head if it weren't jammed tight on his neck.
This temple is clean as Almalexia's conscience, sera. And mind you keep it that way.
Well. Yes. That's the name of one of my sons. Trels Varis. But I have no idea where he is right now. Haven't seen him recently.
Hi %PCRace. You probably want to talk to Meryn backstage. He's in charge of our little troupe here.
I wonder if we'll ever find another actor.
I wonder if we'll ever find another actor.
Oh, my, what's going on? Why did he attack you? Maybe you should talk to Meryn!
That wasn't bad... considering the circumstances. You were very brave.
What's going on?

Do you want to offer me a gift of trama root? Well, outlander, you are not proud. But you are courteous, and in an outlander, that is not a thing to be despised. Very well. I accept your gift. And thank you.

Do you want to offer me a gift of trama root? Well, thank you, outlander, and very kind of you, but I happen to have quite a lot of trama root at the moment. Thank you for the thought, but keep this gift for yourself.

Do you want to offer me a gift? Poor outlander. Even these small things are a puzzle to you. Then bring me some trama root for my larder. I am a hunter, and it is beneath my dignity to scrabble about in the dirt. But you? Perhaps this is a task you can handle.

Do you mean... have I been... under a spell? A curse? And this was caused by Sixth House cultists? Good grief. What have I done... I hope... but I haven't thanked you. Please forgive me. I have nothing to offer but my thanks. But I will tell everyone I know how you have saved my life.
I feel as though I've just awakened from a dream... a terrible dream of the Sixth House.
It is the Hour of Wakening. Dagoth Ur awakes, and comes forth in his glory, and his people shall rejoice, and his enemies shall scatter like dust.
The Devil Dagoth Ur is dead, and all his kin. And the Blight has gone, too, and the skies are blue over Red Mountain.
What? No. Where did you...? Damn!

Ah. I see. You propose that I permit these poor Ahemmusa tribesmen to come take shelter here on the island, and in return, you won't kill me. So the game is 'Challenge and Bluff.' And, given the apparent high level of your skills, I hesitate to call your bluff. So. You win. I concede. I can't speak for the Ordinators, of course, but I promise you may bring the Ahemmusa here, and my followers will not harm them. I swear on the Mad God.

Ah. I see. You propose that I permit these poor Ahemmusa tribesmen to come take shelter here on the island, and in return, you won't kill me. So the game is 'Challenge and Bluff.' And, given your rather impressive reputation, I hesitate to call your bluff. So. You win. I concede. I can't speak for the Ordinators, of course, but I promise you may bring the Ahemmusa here, and my followers will not harm them. I swear on the Mad God.
All right. You don't want to dance. Afraid of getting hurt?
Dance with your partner. Swing the axe and mace. Rough and tumble, the spice of life and death. Don't you understand? Do you want to die like a farmer?
Go ahead. It's your move.
If you want to be a Player, then you want to Play with me. Go ahead, %PCName. You're the guest. You make the first move.

My... goodness. Never have I heard such a speech. Such a moving tale. Such suffering. And right here at our front door. You shame me. Please, bring the poor little things here. We won't hurt them. I can't speak for the Ordinators, of course, but I promise my followers will not harm the Ahemmusa while they are here at Ald Daedroth.

My... goodness. Never have I heard such a speech. Such a moving tale. Such suffering. And right here at our front door. You shame me. Please, bring the poor little things here. We won't hurt them. I can't speak for the Ordinators, of course, but I promise my followers will not harm the Ahemmusa while they are here at Ald Daedroth.
Some just like to watch. They also serve Sheogorath who stand and clap. Please yourself.

Tee-hee. How cute! How sweet of you to offer to spare my life. Thank you, from the bottom of my heart. Tee-hee. Of course, if you were not such a pathetic little worm, that threat would have little more bite. But never mind. Tee-hee. Quite charming.

That's so sad. We all shed a tear for the poor little savages. It's a terrible world for the little helpless things. But... life must have its little tragedies, mustn't it? Or else it would be cheerful and dull.
Well, well, well. Do you have a game you want to play? Tell me...
Well, well, well. What do we have here? Do you have your invitation? Are you a Player of the Game? Or one of the Game Pieces? Or a humble Spectator?

Were you summoned? Or do you come of your own free will? It hardly matters... the party is open to all. But make sure you pay your respects to the host. And grab a drink from Lustidrike, over in the corner. Then feel free to mingle with the other guests, to join the dancing, chancing throng. I believe the ones in the gold masks are party crashers, but all are welcome to the Mad God's Masque and Bellicose Ball.

Your manners are a credit to your upbringing. But there's no need to be so formal. This is a dance, %PCName. If you want to dance, just pick a partner, and start swinging. And if you want ME to be your partner, go ahead. You're the guest. You make the first move.
You're not a Player? Just here to be a Game Piece? Then step right in, pick a partner, and start swinging. I'm sure you'll find someone to accommodate you.
Among mortals, you are indeed great. Among the ancestors, you are of little account.
An ancestor has no trade, but to guard and counsel the living kin.
Honor the ancestors with your heart, not with your tongue.
I am %name. I was called to the prophecies, but I was not the one.
I have failed. I was not the one.

I lived in the late years of the Tribunate, and behind the scenes, I helped us demoralize, then repel the Akaviri invaders. I knew nothing of the Nerevarine or Dagoth Ur until I took refuge with the Ashlanders. I died a fool, trying to loot ruined Kogoruhn. Here. Take these. Maybe there's something in the world left worth stealing.
I wait and hope. Ask, and I shall tell you my story.
Indeed, mortal, death is bitter. But your time will come.
Only the winds of death blow from the lips of mortals.
Speak with disrespect to the spirits, and you will regret it.
The Devil is dead, and the Blight is gone. You are the Nerevarine. You are the Incarnate. You are the one.
Welcome, Incarnate. I am Idrenie Nerothan. I was not the one. But I wait and hope. Ask, and I shall tell you my story.
What use does a spirit have for gold?
You are the Nerevarine. You are the Incarnate. You are the one. You must not fail.
You do right to honor the ancestors.
Your offering does you honor.
Die, %PCRace!
I'm sorry. I busy right now.
As I asked, go to Ald Velothi and speak with Galyn Arvel.
Business? How can you talk about business when people cannot read?
How can I trust you if you cannot stick to the simple rules of House Hlaalu?
How could I wear a ring like that when there is so much suffering in Tamriel? If you want my appreciation, there are better ways to earn it than fancy gifts.
I am always glad to meet another member. There is a family in Ald Velothi, the Arvels, who need our help. Go to Ald Velothi and speak with Galyn Arvel.
I am Ilmeni Dren, daughter of Duke Vedam Dren. Who are you and what are you doing here?
I am sorry. I thought we might have a common interest.
I am sorry. I thought we might have a common interest.
I am sorry. I thought we might have a common interest.
I am spoken for, but if you have the idea I think you have, you should speak with Galyn Arvel in Ald Velothi.
I heard that you helped the Arvel family. When you have time, speak with me again, for there is still much work to done.
I heard that you killed Galyn Arvel. You do not belong in the Twin Lamps.
I heard that you killed Hides-His-Foot. You do not belong in the Twin Lamps.
I heard that you killed Sterdecan. You do not belong in the Twin Lamps.
I heard that you were responsible for the death of that poor Khajiit in Ald Velothi. I should have known better than to trust a foreigner.
I sold the ring. Soon more slaves will be on their way back to Black Marsh or Elsweyr.
Is that my glove?
Keep it. I wouldn't wear that gaudy thing anyway.
Oh, have you seen the twin lamps?
Oh, have you seen the twin lamps?
Thank you, %PCName.
Thank you, %PCName. I am in your debt.
The Bal Molagmer? I remember tales of them told to me when I was a child, and I have heard whisperings recently that they were returning. I accept this ring as a symbol of good faith.
The Bal Molagmer? What do you know of this, thief? I have heard of these noble bandits, but you show no sign of being one. Still, anything taken from a slaver is a good thing.
The real business of Vvardenfell is slavery.

The slaves on the Dren Plantation suffer the worst. One of them knows things about Orvas Dren that are valuable to the Twin Lamps. We can use him to blackmail Orvas Dren. I want you to free Hides-His-Foot from the Dren Plantation. Escort him to Sterdecan's Farm. Hides-His-Foot knows the way.

There are teachers in the Mages Guilds, but they often do not have enough books to teach from. Go to a bookstore and find the books 'Annotated Anuad' and 'ABCs for Barbarians.' Bring a copy of each of these to Vala Catraso in the Ald'ruhn Guild of Mages.
This is for me? What are you suggesting?
Together we will work to end slavery in Vvardenfell.
Vala Catraso is dead? Am I to believe that you are not responsible somehow? No, I shall not have any more business with you.
We won't be so careless in the future.
What business? Prove yourself in House Hlaalu and then perhaps we can discuss business.
What do I want with a slaver's ring?
What do you want, %PCName? I will not pay you or influence my father over this matter.
Where did you... No, I need not ask. Will you return the glove to me?
Yes, %PCName?
Yes, it is my glove.
Yes, it's a shame so many people cannot read.
Yes?
You have done a good deed for Vala Catraso's students. You have my gratitude.
You have done a good deed for Vala Catraso's students. You have my gratitude.
You have done all that I would ask. Continue to do the work of the Twin Lamps.
You have done all that I would ask. Speak with Crassius Curio or my father, Duke Dren.
You have saved Hides-His-Foot from slavery. I am grateful to you and I will speak to my father on your behalf.
And my answer will be the same next time.
I burned that land deed. If Velanda Omani wants my land she'll have to forge another one. I don't know if she'd do that or not, but for now, my land is safe.
I thank you. I have my land deed, and Velanda Omani doesn't.
Just leave me alone. I already told you. I never signed any land deed. I'm not selling my land, and I'm not moving back to Cyrodiil.
Thank you very much. I can't tell you what this means. And...your gloves...they seem somehow familiar...stories I heard as a child. Anyway, I thank you.
Well, I won't argue with you, but I still don't understand why you did this.
What? This looks like the land deed... Why are you giving me this?
Yes? What can I do for you?
You gave me the land deed, and I am grateful.
I am a netch herder. It's long hours, but easy work. Just keep them from wandering off.
Just a friendly warning. Don't spook the netch. Don't worry -- they're completely safe if you don't bother them -- but get them riled up, and they're trouble. Especially the betty netch.

Normally a single betty netch will have a harem of five or six bull netch, but we keep the bull-betty ration closer to one-to-one for faster breeding. Tends to make our betty netch a little more aggressive than they are in the wild.
Remember. Leave the netch alone, and they'll leave you alone.
The betty netch is the tough one. It's the bull netch that's poisonous, but the betty netch is twice as tough and twice as mean.

He came with so many books. Tried to teach us. Then went to the Mabrigash. So many books. They were old, pages always falling out. I kept picking them up after him. If you seek him, look for a trail of pages.
Outlander. You'll find no welcome here, I'm afraid.
We know about the prophecies. Our ashkhan and gulakhans say they are foolish superstition. There will be trouble if you speak with them. Perhaps you should speak to our wise woman, Manirai.

We were told these prophecies were foolish superstition. But you have made many changes here. Now we think, maybe these are not foolish superstition. Maybe you are something special. Maybe we can hope for something better.
You are the outlander who claims to be the Nerevarine? You'll find no welcome here, I'm afraid.

You have slain one of the peace-loving Erabenimsun. You deserve to die. Though we have no champion to bring us justice, we still have our pride. We will not treat with you, even though you threaten to murder us, too.
Do you bring me news of personal vengeance for the death of my husband?
I am amazed. What an interesting story. Thank you for sharing it. Now, then.... Did you want to buy anything?
I congratulate you on gaining Zabamund's help. Now, was there something you wanted to buy?
I thank you, Clanfriend, for giving me vengeance for the murder of my husband.
Now that you are a Clanfriend, can I beg you to assist me with a matter of personal vengeance?

So. You want to speak with Sul-Matuul and Nibani Maesa. I doubt that is possible. You are an outlander, and have no permission to speak with them. You cannot risk offending them. I suggest you speak with the gulakhan Zabamund. His yurt is just across from mine. With a recommendation from a sub-chief like Zabamund, Sul-Matuul might be more willing to speak with you.

This outcast murdered my husband. I have heard that he has taken refuge in a place called Aharasaplit on the island of Sheogorad, the large island north of Vvardenfell. You might find information about Zallay Subaddamael or Aharasaplit camp in the fishing village of Dagon Fel on Sheogorad island.
Welcome, %PCName. Welcome, Urshilaku Nerevarine. I have only these few humble items to offer you.
Welcome, %PCName. Welcome, Urshilaku Nerevarine. I have only these few humble items to offer you.
Welcome, outlander. Do you come to trade? Or is there something you wish to discuss?
Welcome, outlander. I have a few humble items to offer for sale. Or, perhaps, there is something you wish to discuss?

You have killed the murderer of my husband, Airan-Ahhe. I thank you, and do you honor, Clanfriend. I have long kept Airan-Ahhe's spear. He no longer has any use for it. It is with pride that I pass it on to you, and ask only that you remember his name when you use it.

Zallay Subaddamael, an outcast ashlander, betrayed Urshilaku hospitality and killed my husband. If you could find Zallay Subaddamael, kill him, and bring the justice of his death to me, I can promise you a fine reward -- my dead husband's enchanted Spirit Spear. It is a great treasure, but I would be glad if it might purchase the vengeance that would set my husband's spirit to rest. Bring me news of Zallay Subaddamael's death, and the Spirit Spear is yours.
All right. If that's the way you want it...
Go away, stupid. I'd kill you, but it's not worth the trouble.
Nobody cares about that. You just make us tired. Go away.
Oh, all right. If you insist....
What do you want?
Why do you bother us? We don't like you. Go away.
You are the outlander who claims to fulfill the Nerevarine prophecies. What do you want?
You don't listen, outlander.
I am Lanabi, the trader.

Ranis Athrys in the Balmora Mages Guild has something against wizards who aren't in the guild. I think it has something to do with her parents, who were murdered by the old Telvanni Archmagister, the one before Gothren.
His farm is across the river to the northwest.

Admirers of the unarmed, unarmored martial arts traditions of the Marshmerrow, Salt Rice, and Golden Reed societies have adapted them for use in the Mages Guild, in the criminal subcultures, and among opponents of Imperial occupation of Morrowind.

Short bows and long bows use arrows. Crossbows use bolts. Bow and crossbows are more cumbersome, two-handed weapons, but more effective. Throwing stars and throwing knives are fast, light, one-handed attacks, but less damaging than bows and crossbows.
Giras Indaram is right over there if you want to talk with him.
Oh, don't mind me. Whatever affair of honor you have with Giras Indaram, it's none of my business.
Greetings. I am %Name, the caretaker of the Sanctus Shrine.
What brings you here, %PCName?
Yes, this is the Sanctus Shrine. This is the very shack Tholer Saryoni lived in when he wrote his sermons. I am merely the caretaker.

Good day. I'm Llorayna Sethan, publican of the Sethan's Tradehouse here in Tel Branora. We rent beds, and I have a limited selection of goods for barter. If you're new here, I can also tell you where to look for other services, or a specific place nearby. If you're looking  for someone in particular, I may be able to help.
And I suppose you are keeping them at your stronghold? No, you must bring them to me.
Are you here to discuss your stronghold?
Construction on your stronghold will begin soon.
Do not waste my time until you have found the things I seek.
Do not waste my time, then. You must bring me the construction contract and two strong souls.
Do you have the construction contract and two strong souls?
Do you have the Dwemer schematics from Mzanchend and the 5000 gold?
Have you found this book, %PCName?

Here, take these grand soulgems. Fill them with the souls of a suitable Daedra. The best souls to use are Storm Atronachs, but more powerful Daedra such as Winged Twilights and Golden Saints will work as well.

House Telvanni has expanded too quickly. We have allowed our young and ambitious to build unauthorized bases all across Vvardenfell. To avoid trouble with the Grand Council, you should make your stronghold official. Only Duke Vedam Dren in Ebonheart can issue construction contracts.
I am pleased to hear that the mushroom is growing so well. Thank you for keeping me informed. Your stronghold should finish its first stage of growth in a few days.
I cannot build you a stronghold until you have been appointed as the Mouth of one of the Telvanni Councilors.
I gave you two soulgems. Fill them with the souls of Storm Atronachs, Golden Saints, or Winged Twilights. Perhaps someone around here knows where you can find such strong souls.
I have given the orders to begin construction on the next phase of your stronghold.
I oversee the construction of strongholds for House Telvanni. You do not have enough rank in House Telvanni to have your own stronghold.

If you want me to build you a tower fit for a Telvanni Councilor, I will need 5000 drakes for expenses. I also want you to investigate the Dwemer ruin of Mzanchend northwest of your stronghold. Bring me any plans or schematics you find there.
Oh? You do, do you? And where might they be?
Speak with me again when the first stage of your tower is complete. It will only take a few days for it to finish growing.

The second stage of your stronghold is complete. I trust everything is in order? Speak with me again when you are a Master of House Telvanni and I will build you a stronghold fit for the mightiest Telvanni wizards.
Then return to Galom Daeus and continue your search.

There is a book, 'Secrets of Dwemer Animunculi,' which has been lost for many years. I know that this books lies in the Vampire-infested ruins of Galom Daeus. When I have this book in my possession, your stronghold will be the first in ages to be guarded by Dwemer Centurions.

To get to Galom Daeus, go south from your stronghold until you reach a river of lava. Follow that river to the west until it ends. You will see another pool of lava ahead of you. Galom Daeus lies beyond that pool.
Yes, I am Llunela. I am the stronghold builder for House Telvanni.
Yes, I am prepared to build the last stage of your stronghold. Your stronghold will be the first since the fall of Resdayn to be guarded by Dwemer Animunculi.
Yes, I can build you a tower of your own, %PCRank. First you must acquire a construction contract from Duke Vedam Dren. Then you bring me two strong souls to form the foundations of your stronghold.

Yes, I want you to check on your stronghold, which is being built on the alleged site of Uvirith's Grave. I will mark it on your map. Go there and speak with Gashnak gra-Mughol, the foreman in charge of constructing your stronghold.
Yes, I will use these souls to begin construction of your stronghold.

Yes, this is exactly what I need. This, along with the schematics you brought me should be enough to unravel the secrets of Dwemer Centurions. I will give the orders to begin the last phase of your stronghold. It should go quickly... but it should take at least five days.
Yes, this will do. I shall give the orders to begin construction on the rest of your stronghold.
Yes, you have given me the construction contract. I trust it was not too difficult.
You have brought me the book 'Secrets of Dwemer Animunculi.' Soon you will have a stronghold that rivals that of Uvirith himself.
You have brought me the book, %PCName. I hope your stronghold is satisfactory.
You have brought me the soulgems. The power in these souls will strengthen your stronghold's foundations and help the tower grow.
You have found the plans, you but you do not have enough gold.
You have the construction contract, but I also need two strong souls to form the foundations of your stronghold.
You have the gold, but where are the Dwemer Schematics?
You have two strong souls, but you must also get a construction contract from Duke Vedam Dren in Ebonheart.
Your stronghold is complete.
I am %name, a %class. What's it to you?
Can you get me out of here? Let's travel together.
Do you want me to follow you?
Do you want me to follow you?
Do you want me to follow you? Abassel will try and kill me if I leave.
Do you want me to wait here?
I'm glad to be back.
Lead me to the Ald Velothi Outpost.
Lead me to the Ald Velothi Outpost.
No, but thank you. I will rest here and continue my pilgrimage when I can.
Okay. I'll stay right here until you come and get me.
Please, get me back to the Outpost there.
Thank you for getting me to the Ald Velothi Outpost.
Yes, I'm her.

Ancestor ghosts commonly defend the tombs of clan and kin, but may also be summoned and controlled by sorcerers. Ancestor ghosts are aggressive but not very dangerous -- IF you have an enchanted or silvered weapon, or deadly sorcery.
Ash-chancre is an acute blight disease affecting a victim's behavior. It may be contracted from corprus beasts or other blight monsters.
Ash-woe is an acute blight disease affecting a victim's will and thought processes. It may be contracted from corprus beasts or other blighted creatures.
Ataxia is a mild common disease affecting the victim's strength and dexterity. Symptoms include generalized pain and muscle stiffness. It may be contracted from slaughterfish.
Black-heart is an acute blight disease affecting a victim's strength and endurance. It may be contracted from corprus beasts or other blight monsters.

Brown rot is a mild common disease affecting the victim's strength and behavior. Symptoms include necrosis and sleeplessness. It may be contracted from the bonewalker, skeleton, greater bonewalker, or bonelord.
Chanthrax is an acute blight disease affecting a victim's dexterity and mobility. It may be contracted from corprus beasts or other blight monsters.

Chills is an extremely dangerous common disease affecting the victim's mind and coordination. Symptoms include clumsiness and mental confusion. It may be contracted from the bonewalker, skeleton, greater bonewalker, or bonelord.

Collywobbles is a serious common disease affecting a victim's strength, endurance, and mobility. Symptoms include uncontrollable shaking and chronic weariness. It may be contracted from the fiery shalk.

Corprus is a deadly disease that attacks a victim's mind and body. Victims grow mad and violent, and their bodies sprout wild, revolting growths. This disease comes from contact with corprus beasts or other blight monsters

Corprus is a rare form of blight disease. Sometimes crusaders get it from fighting corprus monsters inside the Ghostfence. We can't cure it. Victims are sent to the Corprusarium beneath Tel Fyr, the tower of the Telvanni wizard Divayth Fyr. Victims go mad, and the body becomes fat and distorted with unnatural growths. It is always fatal. Sometimes it progresses slowly, sometimes in a matter of days.
Dampworm is a serious common disease affecting a victim's mobility. Symptoms include uncontrollable muscle spasms and twitching. It may be contracted from the nix-hound.
Droops is a serious common disease that affects a victim's strength. Symptoms include weak and flaccid muscle tissues. It may be contracted from all forms and stages of kwama.
Greenspore is a serious common disease affecting a victim's behavior. Symptoms include irritability and violent outbursts, and may include mild dementia. It may be contracted from slaughterfish.

Helljoint is a mild common disease affecting a victim's mobility and dexterity. Symptoms include persistent irritation and inflammation of joints. It may be contracted from the girdle-tailed cliff racer.

In Morrowind you worry about three kinds of disease -- common disease, blight disease, and corprus disease. Common disease isn't so bad. You can get cured at shrines or temples easily -- but you need to get cured, or people don't want to talk with you. Blight disease is more serious, and potions and cures are harder come by. Corprus disease can't be cured. And some say vampirism is a disease. But the only cure for a vampire is destroying it. Policy on vampires is 'kill on sight.' Or 'run on sight.'

I've heard some say that vampirism is a disease. But no wise woman has ever been able to cure it, and I've never heard of a sorcerer's spell that could cure it. But I admit, I've never encountered a vampire, and never thought about how to cure one. We would destroy them on sight if we could.
Rattles is a mild common diseased affecting a victim's willpower and dexterity. Symptoms include muscle spasms and listlessness. It may be contracted from the nix-hound.

Rockjoint is an acute common disease affecting a victim's manual dexterity. Symptoms include painful swelling and immobility of all joints. It may be contracted from the domesticated guar or dusky alit.
Rust chancre is a mild common disease affecting a victim's mobility and behavior. Symptoms include swelling and rash, and painful muscle spasms. It may be contracted from the waste rat.

Serpiginous dementia is a serious common disease affecting the victim's mind and behavior. Symptoms include hallucinations and an itchy and unsightly scaly skin condition resembling snake scales. It may be contracted from the bull netch and betty netch.
Swamp fever is a mild common disease affecting the victim's strength and behavior. Symptoms include high body temperature and delirium. It may be contracted from the mudcrab.

The four blight diseases are ash-chancre, chanthrax, black-heart, ash woe. They come from touching blighted creatures or from going about in blight storms. Unless you walk upon Red Mountain, you need not fear the blight storms. You need magical resistance to blight disease if you go there.

There are sixteen common diseases, outlander: rockjoint, helljoint, witbane, chills, serpiginous dementia, greenspore, dampworm, rust chancre, droops, ataxia, wither, swamp fever, collywobbles, brown rot, yellow tick, rattles. The healers of the settled peoples divide them into three kinds: mild, serious, and acute. Serious and acute are more dangerous, of course, but none of them are fatal. But you must get them cured, or they weaken you, and people won't want to talk to you.
Witbane is an acute common disease affecting a victim's memory and thought processes. Symptoms include loss of memory and disorientation. It may be contracted from the rat.
Wither is a mild common disease that affects a victim's strength and endurance. Symptoms include loss of energy and shortness of breath. It may be contracted from dreugh.
Yellow tick is a mild common disease affecting a victim's strength and mobility. Symptoms include dark, bruise-like swelling, sensitive to touch. It may be contracted from the least kagouti.
Trebonius gave you some duties? Last year he asked me to dig a tunnel to the mainland so the Telvanni couldn't interfere with Imperial trade. I just tell him it's progressing according to schedule.
Talk to Zennammu in the yurt.

Good day. I'm Manara Othan, publican of The Lizard's Head here in Vivec. We rent beds, and I have a limited selection of goods for barter. If you're new here, I can also tell you where to look for other services, or a specific place nearby. If you're looking  for someone in particular, I may be able to help.
Ahaz is Ulath-Pal's faithful bodyguard. He is not so strong or skilled as Ashu-Ahhe. But wherever you see Ulath-Pal, you will also see Ahaz. If you fight Ulath-Pal, you must also fight Ahaz.
Ashu-Ahhe is a great fighter -- the most strong and experienced of the Erabenimsun. He wears enchanted armor, and boasts that none of the Erabenimsun can defeat him -- not even Ulath-Pal.

But before anything else can be done, you must first eliminate Ulath-Pal and his supporters. Then you should come speak with me, and we will discuss further how you might be named Erabenimsun Nerevarine.

By tokens, I mean well-known tribal heirlooms, objects of power handed down through the generations by gulakhans and ashkhans. Such tokens are marks of power and distinction, and might give Han-Ammu the abilities and confidence he needs.

Han-Ammu is the son of our former chief, Airan-Ammu, but he is nothing like his father. His birth gives him a strong claim to lead the tribe, but of the many virtues required by an ashkhan, he lacks only three things: strength, courage, and wisdom.
Here. Take this enchanted token of the Erabenimsun, that all may know that we have named you Nerevarine and Champion.
I am %Name, wise woman of the Erabenimsun. Do you need my services? Or do you seek my counsel?
I am Manirai, wise woman of the Erabenimsun. You are the outlander who claims to fulfill the Nerevarine prophecies. Do you need my services? Or do you seek my counsel?

I am of the peace-loving Erabenimsun. We only wish to live and hunt as we have in the past, and do not wish to anger our neighbors by raiding and warfare. But Ashkhan Ulath-Pal and his supporters are strong and sure of themselves. They have grown rich by raiding and fighting, and they will not be ruled by the counsel of their wise woman.
I am too busy to meet this Argonian.
I am too busy to meet with animals.
I have no counsel, Nerevarine. We are both traveling in the dark.

I warn you. Be wary of Ashkhan Ulath-Pal and his supporters. They all hate Outlanders, and love nothing more than to kill them and loot them. They do not respect custom or hospitality, and they think nothing of killing unarmed men, women, or children. They are bad men, and bad leaders, and you should fear them.

If you hope to persuade Han-Ammu to become ashkhan, you must find some way to give him strength, willpower, and intelligence. Han-Ammu is unpopular with the tribe, and he knows it.
