Scrap metal refers not to common scraps of iron and steel, but to bits of exotic metals recovered from animated Dwemer artifacts like the centurion. Such metal is rare and precious, and prized both by collectors of antiquities and students of metals and enchantments.
Scribs are a larval form of the kwama. Crushed scribs produce a nutritious but sour-tasting gelatin with modest magical properties that the natives eat with gusto.

Scribs cut into strips and dried in the sun are called scrib jerky. Scrib jerky has modest magical properties, and tastes scarcely worse when spoiled than when fresh, and are a practical foodstuff for the hardy native traveler.
Scuttle is Vvardenfell's favorite local dish. This cheese-like, greasy substance made from the flesh of local beetles is remarkably tasty, and has modest magical properties.

Serpiginous dementia is a serious common disease affecting the victim's mind and behavior. Symptoms include hallucinations and an itchy and unsightly scaly skin condition resembling snake scales. It may be contracted from the bull netch and betty netch.
Shalk resins are the tough, soluble substances extracted from shalk hides. Shalk resins are used as glues and stiffeners in manufacturing bonemold and chitin armors.
Shield potions protect the subject from various forms of physical attack while injuring attackers in close proximity. Shield potions include: fire shield, lightning shield, and frost shield.
Sload soap is a waxy substance made from the immature non-sentient forms of the sload.
Spore pods are collected from the slough fern of the Bitter Coast.
Stoneflower petals are collected from a small common blue flower of the Ascadian Isles and Azura's Coast.
Swamp fever is a mild common disease affecting the victim's strength and behavior. Symptoms include high body temperature and delirium. It may be contracted from the mudcrab.
The coda flower is the fruiting body collected from the primitive draggle-tail plant of the Bitter Coast.

The comberry is a bush that produces a bitter berry, best known as the basis of the native comberry brandy, a rough but potent alcoholic beverage of Morrowind. Comberry is grown in the Ascadian Isles.
The diamond is a rare, transparent, extremely hard gemstone of great value.
The emerald is a transparent green gem with modest magical properties.

The four blight diseases I've seen here on Vvardenfell are ash-chancre, chanthrax, black-heart, ash woe. They are all contracted from blighted creatures or from exposure to blight storms. You don't have to worry about blights storms unless you're entering the Red Mountain region. You need resistance to blight disease protections to go there.
The immature state of the fruiting body of the primitive draggle-tail plant of the Bitter Coast is called the ampoule pod. This pod has modest magical properties prized by alchemists.

The meat of the slaughterfish is meally and noisome, but dried slaughterfish scales are said by locals to be 'a crunchy treat' when prepared in the native manner. Foreigners are advised to beware of slaughterfish scales.
The mudcrab native to Vvardenfell is prized for its sweet crab meat. The flesh of the mudcrab is both tasty and possessed of modest magical properties.
The substance called ghoul heart is heart tissue collected from the remains of an ash ghoul.

The sweet pulp of marshmerrow reeds is a delectable foodstuff, and when eaten fresh or prepared, it has modest healing properties. Marshmerrow is an important cash crop of the farms and plantations of the Ascadian Isles, but it also grows wild in the Grazelands and on Azura's Coast.
The tough hide of the wild alit makes a serviceable multi-purpose leather. Ashlanders hunt the alit and use their tanned hides as trade goods.

There are sixteen common diseases I've encountered on Vvardenfell: rockjoint, helljoint, witbane, chills, serpiginous dementia, greenspore, dampworm, rust chancre, droops, ataxia, wither, swamp fever, collywobbles, brown rot, yellow tick, rattles. We group their effects in three levels: mild, serious, and acute. Serious and acute are more dangerous, of course, but none of them are fatal. But you must get them cured, or they weaken you, and people won't want to talk to you.

These smooth, round, lustrous beads are prized for ornamental purposes. The cave collop and other native Morrowind mollusks only occasionally produce pearls; their scarcity increases their market value.

To make homemade potions, you need skill in alchemy, ingredients, and the necessary apparatus. Ingredients can be collected from the animal bodies, plants, and the environment. There are four pieces of alchemist apparatus -- mortar and pestle, alembic, calcinator, and retort. Alchemical apparatus comes in grades of quality; higher quality apparatus is more effective and reliable.

Toxic potions are potions with undesirable effects. They are not available commercially, and when found, usually represent clumsy or ill-informed attempts to make useful potions by unskilled alchemists. Toxic potions include: drain strength, drain intelligence, drain willpower, drain agility, drain speed, drain personality, drain luck, drain health, drain spell points, drain fatigue, drain endurance, and paralyze.

Vegetable products of commercial value on Vvardenfell include the following: ash yam, bittergreen petals, black anther, black lichen, bloat, chokeweed, comberry, corkbulb root, fire fern, gold kanet, green lichen, hackle-lo leaf, heather, kresh fiber, marshmerrow, moon sugar, muck, red lichen, resin, roobrush, saltrice, scathecraw, stoneflower petals, trama root, wickwheat, and willow anther.
Violet coprinus is a tall, slender-stemmed, light-green-capped mushroom of the Bitter Coast region with modest magical properties.
Void salts are rare crystalline precipitates with modest magical properties collected from the evanescent remains of a slain storm atronach.
Wickwheat is a wild Ashland grain with modest magical properties that grows in the Grazelands.
Willow anther is the powdery residue from pollen-bearing parts of the willow flower that grows in the Ascadian Isles and on Azura's Coast.
Witbane is an acute common disease affecting a victim's memory and thought processes. Symptoms include loss of memory and disorientation. It may be contracted from the rat.
Wither is a mild common disease that affects a victim's strength and endurance. Symptoms include loss of energy and shortness of breath. It may be contracted from dreugh.
Yellow tick is a mild common disease affecting a victim's strength and mobility. Symptoms include dark, bruise-like swelling, sensitive to touch. It may be contracted from the least kagouti.
Are you ready to guide me back to Novor Drethan?
Did Novor Drethan send you? Let's travel together back to the mine entrance.
Do you want me to wait here?
Guide me back to Novor Drethan so he knows I'm safe.
Guide me to the mine entrance.
I will wait for you here.
Now that I'm safe, Novor Drethan can take care of any other Nix Hounds.
Tell me when you're ready to travel together.
Thank you for guiding me back to Novor Drethan.
Thanks for getting me back safely.
These Nix Hounds think the mine is theirs. Let's travel together back to Novor Drethan so he knows I'm safe.
We're on the way back to Novor Drethan, %PCName. Tell me if you no longer want to travel together.

Certainly! The two of us are more than glad to give you your fee. We'd like to thank you again for your companionship. It gets a bit lonely on the road, and sometimes Rollie gets awfully quiet on long trips. (He's getting a little moody in his old age.) Take care, stranger!
Excellent. Let's be on our way.

Finest pack guar I've ever had the privilege of knowing. He and I have been together for years. Sure, he and I have our arguments, and he sometimes can be a little bit stubborn, but we always seem to be able to work things out.
I can't believe he's gone! I don't know what I'm going to do. He was the finest guar I'd ever met...kind, compassionate, funny, loving. I'll miss him terribly.
If you think it's wise. I'll wait here for you.
I've got to get my shipment to Vivec.
I've really got to get my goods to Vivec. It's not cheap trying to feed old Rollie!
No? I'm sorry to hear that. Well, Rollie, it looks like we're on our own. Maybe we'll find someone else to help us.

Okay, %PCName, we've made it. I thank you for your help, and Rollie would if he were allowed in the city. I really must speak with someone about that. Think how much he'd enjoy visiting this place. He'd be talking about it for days. Oh, I suppose you're wondering about compensation for your trouble?
Pardon me! You look like you could use some extra cash. Perhaps you could be of some use to Rollie and me.
Shall we continue on?
Shall we continue on?
Shall we travel together to the shop? It'll be lonely without Rollie, but we'll make it!
She's a clothier in Vivec. Her shop is in the Canalworks of the Foreign Quarter. Sells a nice selection of fine clothing, some provided by yours truly, and transported with care by Rollie.

There's a good fellow! See, Rollie, I told you there are still some good folks in these lands! Rollie's become such a pessimist in his old age, but I told him we'd find someone to help! When we get there, I'll reward you. I think 100 septims seems fair. How about the three of us get going?

Well, %PCName, we're getting pretty close to the city, and they don't let big ol' guar like Rollie here inside the walls. Seems a shame, since he's such a personable sort. Isn't that right, Rollie? Anyway, from here, you and I can travel on to Agrippina's alone.
Well, I figure that 200 septims would be fair. Sounds about right, doesn't it? Yes, that's a fair arrangement. Again, thank you for your trouble. You'll be paid when we arrive at the store.

Well, I'm afraid I can't pay you all of what I promised, with the loss of my beloved Rollie. Here, take this. I'll use the rest to have a proper burial for my one true friend, perhaps build him a memorial. At least most of the goods got here, though. He would have wanted it that way. Farewell.
Well, shall we travel together to our destination?
Yes, he's the best guar in the world! Wouldn't trade him for anything. Plus, I don't think he'd enjoy traveling with others as much as he does with me.

You see, Rollie and I are heading to Vivec to deliver this shipment of clothing to Agrippina Herrenia the clothier. Truly, it's some of the finest clothing you'll ever see...perhaps I could interest you in some? Well, regardless, I've heard rumor that the road to Vivec has become rather dangerous of late. Perhaps you'd be willing to escort the two of us? Rollie and I would be most appreciative, and would be willing to offer some compensation.
Do you know what the Legion does with the stolen goods they take off their prisoners? They stick them in evidence chests, right there in the forts.
I am %name, a %class. What's it to you?
Just a coincidence, I assure you. Nine-Toes is the real murderer.
Me? No, you are mistaken. It was that Argonian, Nine-Toes.
Thanks for trusting me, %PCName.
A villager in Tel Mora has fallen ill, but there is no Temple in Tel Mora where she can go for healing. Go to Tel Mora and cure Lette.
Another duty of the Temple is to cleanse Vvardenfell of vampires. We have heard of a vampire lair known as Galom Daeus.
As I said, go to Mount Kand and answer the Daedra's riddles. If you answer correctly, you do not have to fight them.
Delvam Andarys is dead. You have done the Temple a great service. When you are ready, I have more urgent duties for you.

Delvam Andarys is in Mawia, which is southeast of Molag Mar. From here, follow the river to the east as it heads south. It is not far before it opens into a lake. Turn east again and look for an island just south of the coast. Go there, find Delvam Andarys, and make certain that he does not escape the justice of the Temple.
Did you cure Lette?

Has Lette been cured? You are indeed worthy of the Tribunal's praise. Perhaps you would enjoy this book. Although it is clearly heretical, it contains a gem of truth in it's lesson on healing and resistance. Are you ready for more duties?
Have you cleansed the vampires from Galom Daeus?
Have you made the Pilgrimage to Mount Kand?
I have given you the garb of one of the Temple's vampire hunters. When you are ready, slay Raxle Berne in the Dunmer stronghold of Galom Daeus.
I have heard that you claim to be the Incarnate. I do not know the truth of the matter, but for now I will not give you duties.
I have heard that you claim to be the Incarnate. I do not know the truth of the matter, but for now I will not give you duties.
I have heard that you claim to be the Incarnate. I do not know the truth of the matter, but for now I will not give you duties.
I have heard that you claim to be the Incarnate. I do not know the truth of the matter, but for now I will not give you duties.
I have no more duties for you. Try speaking with Tuls Valen in Ald'ruhn or Uvoo Llaren in Ghostgate.

I want you to make the Pilgrimage to Mount Kand, which is northwest of Molag Mar. It's on the left side of the trail. I will mark it on your map. On Mount Kand, Vivec won a contest of wits with three Daedra. There are few lights in the caverns. You may need these potions. If you are not good with riddles, you may want to find a copy of 'The Yellow Book of Riddles.' Several booksellers have this book.
Is the Necromancer Delvam Andarys no longer a threat to the Temple?
Lette is dead.
One duty of the Temple is to bring justice to Necromancers wherever we may find them. We have heard of a Necromancer known as Delvam Andarys.

Please take the holy implements of the Temple's greatest vampire hunters. When you are ready, the elder vampire Raxle Berne hides from the light in the Dwemer ruin of Galom Daeus. I will mark Uvirith's Grave on your map. From there go south until you reach a river of lava. Follow that river to the west until it ends. Galom Daeus lies ahead of you across another pool of lava.

Please take the holy implements of the Temple's greatest vampire hunters. You might want to fight against some of Vvardenfell's lesser evils before you take on this challenge, but you have done well in the Temple so far. When you feel you are ready, the elder vampire Raxle Berne hides from the light in the Dwemer ruin of Galom Daeus. I will mark Uvirith's Grave on your map. From there go south until you reach a river of lava. Follow that river to the west until it ends. Galom Daeus lies ahead of you.
Raxle Berne is already dead? By your own hands? Then you deserve the traditional garb of the Temple's vampire hunters. I salute you, %PCRank %PCName.
Raxle Berne is dead. He shall no longer plague the lands of Vvardenfell. You have earned great honor with the Temple.

Speak with me again when you have gained the rank of Curate. I will have more duties for you then. Until then, you could ask Tuls Valen at the Ald'ruhn Temple, or Endryn Llethan at the High Fane in Vivec.
The symptoms include high body temperature and delirium, but there are no easily visible signs. It can be cured with a standard potion of cure disease, or you may attempt to cure it with a spell.
The Temple does not proselytize, but we do good works for non-believers. Lette, a Redguard in Tel Mora, has swamp fever. Cure her of swamp fever and return to me.

This is the stronghold of Molag Mar. It is a garrison maintained by the Tribunal Temple and House Redoran. Many come here to rest before making the dangerous pilgrimages to Mount Kand and Mount Assarnibibi.
To prove that you are wise and brave, you must make the Pilgrimage to Mount Kand.
What did you say? Lette is dead? I see. That is indeed unfortunate.
Yes, I heard you defeated the Daedra at Mount Kand in a contest of riddles and received Vivec's blessings. I celebrate your success. I have other duties for you when you are ready.
You already brought justice to Delvam Andarys? You have done the Temple a great service. I have more urgent duties for you.
You brought the Temple's justice to Delvam Andarys.
You did what?! You killed her? By all that is sacred! This will damage our relations with the commoners greatly. Listen to me, %PCName, perhaps the %Faction is not your calling.
You have been expelled from the Temple.
You have been expelled from the Temple.
You have been expelled from the Temple.
You have been expelled from the Temple.
You have cured Lette. Well done.
You have slain Raxle Berne. Galom Daeus is no longer a plague waiting to strike out upon the land.
A den of Kagouti have been attacking travelers just south of the Ouada Samsi. Find this Kagouti den, kill the pack leader, and report back to me.
A diseased shalk got into an egg mine on the trade route to Ald'ruhn. I need someone to kill the shalk in the Ashimanu Mine.
Are the cultists in Ashalmawia dead?
Are you here to deliver the potion?
Did you take care of that shalk in the Ashimanu Mine?
Did you take care of the kagouti den on the Gnisis-Ald'ruhn road?
Do you have the report from Shishi?
Do you have the Shishi report?
Go to Ashalmawia, just east of Ald Velothi. Find the foul Daedra worshipper Gordol, kill him, and report your victory to me.
Good work, %PCName. We need to keep the trade routes running, even with all that's going on.
Good. The Arvel family will be grateful. Anything I can do for you? I might have some duties for you later.
Gordol is dead and the Fourth Corner shall no longer plague the citizens of Ald Velothi. Please take this spear as a reward from me, and from St. Veloth, the patron of our village.

He's a Slaughterfish we see around here every couple of years. He came back bigger and meaner than ever and has been hanging around the docks. Me and him go way back... But this time he's gone too far. Kill him before he puts my fishermen out of business.
House Redoran gave you two chances and you failed us. I have no duties for such as you.

House Redoran sent a party to destroy the Telvanni base Shishi. They were supposed to report back to me, but they have not done so. I need someone to find out what's going and bring me the Shishi report.
I can't give duties to you, %PCRank.
I can't give you duties unless you join House Redoran. I suggest talking to Neminda in Ald'ruhn. She's the one who usually signs up new Hirelings.
I don't have any more duties for you. Like I said, it's quiet here in Ald Velothi. Check with Neminda in Ald'ruhn or Faral Retheran in Vivec.
I don't have any more duties right now. Things are usually quiet here in Ald Velothi. Something might turn up. Why not do a few more duties for Neminda and check back with me?
I have no more duties for you. Speak with Faral Retheran in the Redoran Treasury in Vivec or with Athyn Sarethi.
I have some duties for you, but this is a tough one. We need someone to slay the cultists in Ashalmawia.
I haven't heard about any more trouble along the caravan track, %PCName.
I heard there's been another problem along the Gnisis-Ald'ruhn caravan track. Kagouti have been attacking travelers between Ald'ruhn and Gnisis. I need someone to find this kagouti den.
I heard you killed the shalk. Good work, %PCName.
I heard you were expelled, %PCName.
I heard you were expelled, %PCName.
I heard you'd been expelled, %PCName.
I heard you'd been expelled, %PCName.
I hope the mine gets back up and running soon. There's few enough egg mines as it is.
I need that report. There may be lives at stake.
I'm Theldyn. What can I do for you?
Is Old Blue Fin finally dead?

Nords are dangerous savages dressed up as civilized people. Everything good about the Nords is borrowed from the Dunmer. Greed, violence, primitive religion, and treacherous history are all you can expect from Nords.
Not right now, %PCName. Maybe in a few days. Make sure you tell Neminda that you delivered the potion.
Oh, I'm sorry. I was expecting a potion from Ald'ruhn, so I assumed...
Oh, you killed the shalk already? Good work, %PCName.
Ouada means 'river,' outlander. The Samsi river is the one south and east of Gnisis. The Kagouti have been attacking travelers on the trail just a few paces south of the river.

Shishi is a Velothi tower in the middle of the Foyada Bani-Dad northwest of Maar Gan. Go to Maar Gan, head east past the Silt Strider, then follow the Foyada north and west until you see it. It's right in the middle of the Foyada. The leader of the expedition you need to speak with is Brerama Selas.
Shishi is still disputed territory. I hope the Duke does something about all these rogue Telvanni soon.
So Old Blue Fin is finally dead. The Dreughers here in town asked me to give you this Dreugh wax if you got rid of Old Blue fin.
Thank you again for delivering the potion. One of the Arvel family was ill.
Thank you for asking, %PCName. Normally things are pretty quiet in Ald Velothi, but Old Blue Fin is back and up to his old tricks. It's time someone got rid of Old Blue Fin for good.
Thanks for the report, %PCName. Hopefully the Telvanni will give up their claims on the tower now.
The Arvels have lived here for years. Despite their Hlaalu connections, they are decent and generous.
The cultists in Assannidatinti are no more.

The diseased shalk has been infecting Kwama and miners, so the mine's been abandonded. Kill the shalk and report back to me. I just heard some reports of Kagouti attacking traders along that route as well, so be careful. If you see any Kagouti near there, kill them too. It's best to start in Gnisis and cross the river south of the silt strider. When you reach a rough trail, follow it east and south. When the trail branches south and east, take the east fork.
This is Ald Velothi, outlander. Looking for someone in particular? You need services? Or are you looking for some specific place?
Welcome, %PCName. I'm %Name. This is the fishing village of Ald Velothi. Can I help you find someone in particular? Were you looking for services?  Is there some specific place you want?
Well, I guess the Kagouti you already killed near there are the ones that were attacking travelers. If I hear about any more attacks I'll let you know.
Well, where is it? Bring me that report, %PCName.
What brings you back to Ald Velothi, %PCName?
Without Old Blue Fin stirring things up, Ald Velothi will be quiet again. You know, I'm almost sorry to see him go.
Yes, I'm Theldyn Virith. Sort of the Hetman of Ald Velothi.
Yes, this is the report I wanted. What was that? You also found a Telvanni wizard hiding there? Good work, %PCName. Maybe now the Telvanni will give up their claims to Shishi.
You are? You're here to deliver the potion? Well, where is it?
You've broken our rules and have been expelled from House Redoran. I can't give you duties unless you make amends.

Ah, keep the Ebony Mail, %PCName. Treat it well and do good deeds when you wear it. You are the new %NextPCRank. I have long wanted to retire from the politics of the Temple and write another book of sermons.
Are you here to request an audience, %PCRank?
Do the duties I give you and you will earn advancement.
Faith conquers all, Nerevarine. Bless your breath and blood.
First you must advance to the rank of %NextPCRank.

Good. Here are two keys: one to the private back entrance to my quarters, the other to a locked entrance to Lord Vivec's palace. I regret that, at present, the Ordinators are not completely under my control, so, for now, I'll ask you to avoid confrontations with them. Lord Vivec is expecting you. His Lordship is remarkably patient, but perhaps it would be better not to keep him waiting.

Good. Here are two keys: one to the private back entrance to my quarters, the other to a locked entrance to Lord Vivec's palace. I regret that, at present, the Ordinators are not completely under my control, so, for now, I'll ask you to avoid confrontations with them. Lord Vivec is expecting you. His Lordship is remarkably patient, but perhaps it would be better not to keep him waiting.
Good. Yes, I will place this robe somewhere safe. I will speak with Berel Sala and see to it that the Ordinators take their orders from the Temple.
Have you completed the Pilgrimages of the Four Corners?
Have you found the Ebony Mail, %PCName?
Have you found the Ebony Mail?
I am old and will soon retire. You are one of the most promising %PCRanks. If you want to replace me as Archcanon of the Temple, you must complete the Pilgrimages of the Four Corners.
I do not have any duties for you at this time, %PCRank. Speak with me again when you have earned the rank of Diviner.

I have heard that Lord Vivec and you have spoken. And now it appears that the Temple and the Dissident Priests shall be reconciled, and that we shall all be working together towards a common end. It is more than I could have hoped.
I have heard that you claim to be the Incarnate. This is a serious matter. Before we discuss the Ebony Mail, let me pray and meditate on the validity of these rumors.
I have heard that you claim to be the Incarnate. This is a serious matter. Before we discuss this, let me pray and meditate on the validity of these rumors.
I have heard the Duke's concerns. Rest assured that from now on, there will be limits to the Ordinator's influence.
I understand your concerns, but the Ordinators are a necessity. Especially in these troubling times.
If you want my aid, you must give me the robe.

I'm sorry that is the position you choose to take. It is important that we trust one another, and, at present, I do not feel I can trust you. Perhaps we are not ready yet to discuss changing the Temple's position towards you.
I'm sorry, but the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine is clear. I'm afraid we have nothing to discuss.

I'm sorry, but the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine is clear. The Nerevarine prophecies are evil superstitions, based on lies and delusions. And even if the prophecies were genuine, since you have killed one of the leaders of the Ashlander tribes, now there is no possibility that you could be accepted by the Ashlander tribes as the Nerevarine of prophecy. I'm afraid we have nothing to discuss.
I'm sorry, but we have nothing to discuss.

I'm sorry. I understand. Then we have nothing further to discuss at this time. I will not apologize for the Temple's actions against you, or against the Dissident Priests. But I do believe it is time for such hostilities to stop. I regret that, at present, the Ordinators are not completely under my control, so I cannot guarantee that you will not be harmed. But if you change your mind, and are willing to meet with Vivec, please return to me at any time.

I'm sorry. I understand. Then we have nothing further to discuss at this time. I will not apologize for the Temple's actions against you, or against the Dissident Priests. But I do believe it is time for such hostilities to stop. I regret that, at present, the Ordinators are not completely under my control, so I cannot guarantee that you will not be harmed. But if you change your mind, and are willing to meet with Vivec, please return to me at any time.

It is most unfortunate that you have killed more of the Temple's faithful Ordinators. It is not that you were unprovoked. But the fact that you do not make more of an effort to spare the lives of these earnest, innocent servants of the Temple that disturbs us. Surely it is within your power to avoid them, or avoid killing them. What do you have to say to that?

It is rare, but recently... Perhaps you could help with one of these failures. There is a cavern, Assemanu, known to those who follow Dagoth Ur. In this cavern is the Robe of St. Roris, a holy relic. If you can succeed where the Ordinators failed by bringing me the Robe, I will speak with Berel Sala.
It is unfortunate, but you have been expelled from the Temple. Make amends, if you can, and I will speak to you of this.
Lord Vivec is expecting you. His Lordship is remarkably patient, but perhaps it would be better not to keep him waiting.

Our situation is desperate. But I would rather have you hear the details of our situation, and the circumstances leading up to that situation, from Lord Vivec himself. He has asked to see you. Would you agree to a private meeting with him, and hear in person what he has to say?

Our situation is desperate. But I would rather have you hear the details of our situation, and the circumstances leading up to that situation, from Lord Vivec himself. He has asked to see you. Would you agree to a private meeting with him, and hear in person what he has to say?
Perhaps you are not devoted enough to be the %NextPCRank of the Temple.
Please leave. These are my private quarters.
So you found it? Where is it? I don't see it...
Thank you for coming, %PCName. You know the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine. Perhaps it is time to change that doctrine.
Thank you for coming, %PCName. You know the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine. Perhaps it is time to change that doctrine.

Thank you. I know these are just words, and it is naive to trust words, but I feel it is time to risk trusting one another. I believe we are ready to discuss changing the Temple's doctrine concerning the Nerevarine prophecies and your claim to them.

The Devil is dead, and the Blight is gone. Praise Almsivi, and bless you, Nerevarine. Now we must set ourselves to work on reconciling the Dissident Priests with the Temple hierarchy. It should be difficult. We have been greatly at fault. But, with energy and goodwill, we must make a start. It is strange, however. that I have not heard from Lord Vivec. From time to time he does disappear, for reasons of his own, but it seems odd that he should be absent now in the moment of his triumph.

The Devil is dead, and the Blight is gone. Praise Almsivi, and bless you, Nerevarine. Now we must set ourselves to work on reconciling the Dissident Priests with the Temple hierarchy. It should be difficult. We have been greatly at fault. But, with energy and goodwill, we must make a start.
The Ebony Mail is yours. You are the new %NextPCRank of the Temple.

The Ebony Mail may be found on Mount Assarnibibi, which is north of Molag Mar. Mount Assarnibibi is where Molag Bal oversaw the 99 lovers of Boethiah that gave birth to Almalexia. Go there and pray before the shrine. If you are worthy, you will receive the Ebony Mail. Return it to me and I will make you %NextPCRank of the Temple.

The First Corner of the House of Troubles is Malacath, the Daedric patron of the Orcs who tests the Dunmer for weakness. There is a shrine to Malacath on Sheogorad, southwest of Dagon Fel. Head south past the Dwemer ruins and take the second road to the west. Look for the shrine to the north. Take four Daedra hearts to the shrine. When you donate the hearts at the shrine, recite Vivec's 'Four Corners of the House of Troubles.'

The Fourth Corner of the House of Troubles is Sheogorath, the Mad Star, who threatens the Dunmer with madness. It is time to renew a pact Vivec made with Sheogorath long ago. To do so, you must find the Gambolpuddy.

The Second Corner of the House of Troubles is Mehrunes Dagon, the Daedra of Destruction who represents the trials the Dunmer face in the lands of Morrowind. At Ald Sotha, the daedric ruins northeast of Vivec City, Vivec rescued Sotha Sil, the only survivor of the minor House Sotha, from the armies of Mehrunes Dagon. Fight your way to the statue of Mehrunes Dagon and recite Vivec's 'Four Corners of the House of Troubles.'

The Temple must protect the people from false doctrines. And your association with Imperial intelligence makes your motivations and integrity suspect. But we have reached a crisis with Dagoth Ur. We can no longer defend the people against the awakened Sixth House. You and your prophecies may represent our last hope.

The Temple must protect the people from false doctrines. And your association with Imperial intelligence makes your motivations and integrity suspect. But you have been chosen Hortator and Nerevarine by the Dunmer people. And we have reached a crisis with Dagoth Ur. We can no longer defend the people against the awakened Sixth House. You and your prophecies may represent our last hope.

The Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine is clear. The Nerevarine prophecies are evil superstitions, based on lies and delusions. Attacks on the Temple cannot be tolerated. The people's faith in the Tribunal is all that protects us from the hosts of Dagoth Ur. And your association with the Emperor's Intelligence service makes your motivations and integrity suspect. We believe you to be a False Incarnate, and a danger to the Temple and the Dunmer people, and our Ordinators will treat you as an enemy.

The Third Corner of the House of Troubles is Molag Bal, who tries to destroy the Dunmer by corrupting our bloodlines. Bal Ur is known as the Birthplace of Molag Bal where the Doom Drum tricked Molag Bal into becoming mortal. Vivec defeated Molag Bal here and sent him back into Oblivion. Bal Ur is just north of Suran, but to get there easily, you will need a way to levitate over the mountains.

There are many troubles in these times, but with the return of the Robe of St. Roris I have renewed faith in the Tribunal. I believe the troubles between the Temple and House Hlaalu are a test of our patience and piety. I will make sure the Ordinators do not fail this test.

There is the Blight and the return of Dagoth Ur. There are troubles with the Empire and troubles between the Great Houses. The Temple needs protection in these times, and the Ordinators provide that, even though the Ordinators have failed on occasion.

To get to Assemanu, take the southern road towards Seyda Neen. After you cross the bridge, you will see swamplands to the south. Go across the swamps and look for an island to the south. Assemanu is on that island.
We're here to discuss the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine, %PCName.

Yes, I know it is a strange name, but all Sheogorath's creations have the touch of madness. Find the Gambolpuddy in Ald Daedroth and donate it to Sheogorath's statue there while reciting Vivec's 'Four Corners.' This will renew the pact and prevent Sheogorath from tormenting us with madness. Ald Daedroth is on one of the islands between Sheogorad and Azura's Coast. I will mark this place on your map.
Yes, you found it and returned it to Sheogorath. The pact has been renewed.
You already made these pilgrimages, %PCRank.
You are no longer a member of the Temple. I have nothing more to say to you.
You are the Archcanon now, %PCName. I will retire from the politics of the Temple and devote the rest of my life to writing.
You have been expelled from the Temple. If you cannot obey our simple rules, you will never advance far in the Temple.
You have brought me the Robe of St Roris. For this I will speak with Berel Sala, and I will not let him influence Temple policy as much as in the past.
You have completed the Pilgrimages of the Four Corners. Now you should know the enemies of the Temple. I ask only one more thing. You must recover the Ebony Mail.
You have finished the Pilgrimages of the Four Corners of the House of Troubles. I may have more duties for you.
You have killed one of the Ashlander tribal leaders. You are not the type of person we want in the Temple.
You have killed one of the Ashlander tribal leaders. You are not the type of person we want in the Temple.
You have said all the right things, and yet... I do not feel I can trust you. Perhaps we are not ready yet to discuss changing the Temple's position towards you.
You have succeeded where the Ordinators have failed. Give me the robe and I will help Duke Dren control the Ordinators.
You have succeeded where the Ordinators have failed. I will listen to your words and do what I can to control the Ordinators.
You have the Robe of St. Roris the martyr. It is the robe he wore when he was slain and was thus blessed with his blood. Will you hand over the robe now?
Alright, perhaps I can talk sense into my bother. Just tell him I said that paying the debt would be the honorable thing to do.
If Giras owes a debt, why are you asking me about it?
If he challenged you to a duel, you should accept to uphold your own honor. Even if it is clear that my brother is the one at fault.
Talk to my brother, Giras. Tell him that I said its time he started showing some responsibility.
Well, perhaps you can settle this issue yourself.
You have slain my brother, n'wah.
You have slain my brother, n'wah.
Come back when you've got all my glass.
If you know what's good for you, %PCRace, you'll leave me alone and be on your way.
I've got my glass, and you've gained some knowledge. Not a bad bargain. Off with you now.
Listen up, if you really care. My former 'guards' just ran off and stole all my goods.
Lord, Mother, and Wizard! What are you still doing here? Go away!

My glass, and those fetchers left to rot...excellent! Teach criminals like that to meddle with an honest trader. Now, let me tell you about a few tricks of the trade. I think they'll come in handy for you....
Well, get moving, then. Go on! Go!

Yes, a whole shipment of raw glass. If you can return my goods, and kill those bastards who took them, I'd be willing to teach you a couple trader's secrets that could save you plenty of money in the future. My 'guards,' Alvur Hleran and Dondir, probably haven't gone far. Stupid fetchers are probably holed up somewhere near here, counting my loot! Check to the southeast. That's the direction they headed.

You've gotten my glass back. Excellent. Damn shame you didn't kill those traitorous sons of bitches, but I'll take what I can get. Well, a deal's a deal, so let me tell you a little about the merchant trade....
You've gotten my glass back. Excellent. Too bad you didn't kill them both, but one is better than none. Well, a deal's a deal, so let me tell you a little about the merchant trade....
You've gotten my glass back. Excellent. Too bad you didn't kill them both, but one is better than none. Well, a deal's a deal, so let me tell you a little about the merchant trade....
If this is your decision, %PCName, so be it. Here, take this as a token of our friendship. I hope to meet you again. Travel with the winds, my friend.

These are the lands of our people, and the guar hides this trader carried were of our herds. It was our right to take back these hides, and we deny his claim on them. Why has he sent you on this errand? Is he not man enough to defend himself? But...since you take this man's part, for friendship, we will return the hides to you.

These are the lands of our people, and the guar hides this trader carried were of our herds. It was our right to take back these hides, and we deny his claim on them. Why has he sent you on this errand? Is he not man enough to defend himself? We will die before seeing that Imperial dog get our hides.
Very well, %PCName. Let this trader know that should he step foot on our lands again, we will not be so generous with him, be he your friend or not. Travel with speed, my friend.
We will abide by your decision.
You have heard our stance on this issue, and it will not waver.
I am a Special Advisor to Guildmaster Trebonius on Dunmer Issues.
If you don't stop making baseless accusations, I will be forced to make a complaint to Trebonius.
Telvanni spy? Not that I know of. I am a special advisor to Arch-Mage Trebonius on Dunmer Issues. You can check my credentials with Trebonius himself.
We get along rather well. He is always willing to listen to my advice.
Well, I hope you're satisfied.
Yes, speak with Trebonius. He will clear me of any suspicion.
Yes, those are my credentials. What about them?
Have you heard he has given his house to the Temple and is studying to be a priest at the Ald'ruhn Temple? The word is all over town.

I see you have the racer suede belt from Ienas Sarandas. And I hear Ienas Sarandas was found dead in his home. I don't suppose YOU had anything to do with that? Here's the 25 drakes I promised you. And I'll take the goods. But don't expect me to thank you for them. No debt is worth a man's life. Of course, there were no witnesses. But everyone knows you killed that poor fool. Don't think anyone here will forgive you for that.
I see you have the racer suede belt from Ienas Sarandas. Here are the 25 drakes for your services. And thank you very much for handling this situation so well. I really appreciate it.
I see you have the racer suede belt from Ienas Sarandas. Here are the 25 drakes for your services. Thank you very much.

I sold an Ashlander hand-crafted racer suede belt to a customer, but he has failed to make his final payment on time. If you would find Ienas Sarandas and get back my belt, or get the overdue payment of 50 septims he owes me, I will pay you 25 gold.
Thank you again.
Thank you again. You handled the affair very well.

The young fellow's family has lived in Ald'ruhn a long time. His parents died recently and left him their house and estate. But Ienas has fallen in with a fast crowd. I believe he's taken to drinking expensive liquor and has incurred some gambling debts. He's a charming lad, everyone likes him, but he's not very sensible, and suddenly becoming rich seems to have made him an irresponsible fool.
Welcome back. Look around for yourself. Inspect my offerings. Or shall I tell you about my trade? Or perhaps... would you be interested in doing a little work for me?

Welcome, %PCName. Welcome to the humble shop of Tiras Sadus, trader, and purveyor of quality general merchandise. Shall I tell you about my trade? Or would you perhaps be interested in doing a little work for me?
You've been paid.
The Morag Tong is weak! I shall defeat you!
You're no match for me!
Just between you and me, I always rest here between pilgrimages.
No? Hrmph. Well, I'm not moving from this spot until someone goes with me.
Really? Oh, that's great. Okay, let's get going. This has to get to Carnius as soon as possible.
Uhhh....hey. Are you busy right now? I don't mean to bother you, but there's this report I need to deliver...
We've got to keep moving. I don't want to get in trouble for not delivering this report on time!

Yeah, how did you know? I'm supposed to take this to the Fort, but..... but I don't really want to go. There's wolves and bears and things out there, you know? I'd feel much safer if I had an escort. Do you think maybe you'd go with me? I do need to get there soon.
I do not wish to discuss it.
I hope you found whatever you were looking for. She is no longer a member of this family.
If I tell you, will you leave here and promise to never mention the subject in my presence again?
Nalvilie Saren is disgraced. Please do not remind me of this.
Please leave. I do not want to discuss this any more.
Very well. Nalvilie owns a consignment shop on the south-side canals of the St. Olms Canton. She is disgraced, and she disgraces any who speak with her. Now, please leave as you promised.
What? No... You're from the Morag Tong! You won't take me!
Do you want the blessings of the Tribunal?
I heard you rescued the pilgrim. I guess the Ashlander that came here demanding ransom for a famous noble was confused.
If you are on the pilgrimage here, I may assist you. Do you want the blessings of the Temple?
If you are on the pilgrimage here, I may assist you. Do you want the blessings of the Temple? If you've killed Anhaedra recently, you may have to wait a few days for his body to reform.
If you need assistance, speak with me.
Very well. Stand still.

Well, maybe. An Ashlander came here the other day demanding tribute for the esteemed noble 'Bindin Gildaran' or somesuch. I didn't know of any Redoran noble by that name, so I just passed the report on. The Ashlander said to go west out of Maar Gan along the road towards the mountains and then head south along the mountains to get to his camp.
You have completed the Pilgrimage to the Shine of Maar Gan.
You have done well, Outlander. Wisdom and praise be unto you. Culminate your pilgrimage by reading the inscription on the rock.
Yes, I knew her. I sometimes wish I didn't. It's not a good thing these days to have been one of her lovers. If you really want to see her, she lives near here, in St. Olms Canalworks South-One.
Been hearing voices at night. Do you?
Somebody said Larrius Varro over at Fort Moonmoth is looking for you. Said he wanted to talk to you. Don't know what about.

And you don't HAVE 3000 gold right now? I suppose you plan to get it to me 'right away'? Why don't I trust you? Well, thank you for your generous offer, but I'm afraid not. The only way to be sure of preserving our secret is to seal your lips -- permanently. I regret the loss of life -- but it is the risk you run when you break into someone's secret office.

Congratulations. You have produced an original and entertaining excuse. Completely unbelievable, of course, but none the worse for that. Never heard a believable excuse before, anyway. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Oh, well. Since our offices are no longer secret, we'll have to relocate immediately. But don't touch anything here, and don't interfere with myself or my colleagues, or you will not leave here alive.

Congratulations. You have produced an original and entertaining excuse. Completely unbelievable, of course, but none the worse for that. Never heard a believable excuse before, anyway. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Just go... and keep your mouth shut.
Do I know an anonymous writer? No comment.

Hmm. You are a shrewd judge of character. I am a man of principle, and will not hold my common tongue for a payment of gold. But I know what benefits gold can do if it is used in a good cause. Very well. I will not discuss King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. You have my word. And I'll take your 3000 gold, and will contribute it to the Widows and Orphans Fund. And now, if you'll excuse me, we'll have to relocate immediately, now that the secret of our office is spoiled.

'Honest.' So you expect me to trust you? My experiences with trusting adventurers like you have been disappointing in the past. But... this time, you may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Just go... and keep your mouth shut.
I haven't printed lies about King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. I've only printed the truth. And I intend to keep on printing the truth in 'The Common Tongue' -- unless you think you can stop me.
I haven't printed lies about King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. I've only printed the truth. And I intend to keep on printing the truth in 'The Common Tongue' -- unless you think you can stop me.

I know you by reputation, %PCName. You've done some remarkable things. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Oh, well. Since our offices are no longer secret, we'll have to relocate immediately. But don't touch anything here, and don't interfere with myself or my colleagues, or you will not leave here alive.

I said you could go. So go. But I warn you -- don't touch anything here, and don't interfere with myself or my colleagues, or you will not leave here alive. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have work to do....

I see. You've made a serious mistake. I don't approve of your trade -- but I understand that a desperate person -- or imprudently greedy person -- may turn his hand to crime without being truly evil. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Oh, well. Since our offices are no longer secret, we'll have to relocate immediately. But don't touch anything here, and don't interfere with myself or my colleagues, or you will not leave here alive.

I see. You've made a serious mistake. I don't approve of your trade -- but I understand that a desperate person -- or imprudently greedy person -- may turn his hand to crime without being truly evil. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Just go... and keep your mouth shut.

I'm afraid not. The only way to be sure of preserving our secret is to seal your lips -- permanently. I regret the loss of life -- but it is the risk you run when you break into someone's secret office.
I'm true to my word. I said I would not discuss King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. That's what you wanted, and that's what you've got. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have work to do....
I've presented my views on this subject elsewhere. You're welcome to examine them at your leisure.
Of course you're right. And of course if I kill you first, I preserve the secret of my hidden office. The choice is easy.
That's me.

Well. I must say, you've done your research. You've located Granny Varis and Gee-Pop Varis. I value truth -- but I value the lives of my parents more highly. Very well. I will not discuss King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. You have my word. And now, if you'll excuse me, we'll have to relocate immediately, now that the secret of our office is spoiled.

What are you doing here? And may I suggest you make your answer very clear, because this office and what we do here is a well-kept-secret. And we wish to keep it a secret, even if it means that you do not leave her alive.

What are you doing here? And may I suggest you make your answer very clear, because this office and what we do here is a well-kept-secret. And we wish to keep it a secret, even if it means that you do not leave her alive.

You are not a very good judge of character. I am a man of principle, and will not hold my common tongue for a payment of gold. And of course if I kill you first, I preserve the secret of my hidden office. The choice is easy.
You! You killed my father!
You! You killed my mother!
A dark cult is practicing the foulest of arts only a few hours from here in the cavern of Hassour.
A man in Suran named Elvil Vidron is a False Incarnate.
Bulfim gra-Shugharz is dead.
Bulfim gra-Shugharz is dead? That is a shame. Perhaps you can prove your compassion some other way.

Elvil Vidron in Suran claims to be the Nerevarine and makes prophecies of doom. Clearly he is a heretic. Convince him that he is mistaken or, if all else fails, prove it by killing him. If he is the true Nerevarine, he is protected by prophesy and cannot die.
Elvil Vidron in Suran claims to be the Nerevarine and makes prophecies of doom. We cannot have two Nerevarines. Go to him and prove to him that you are the true Incarnate.
Elvil Vidron is already dead? That is unfortunate. I wish we could have saved him.
Elvil Vidron will do penance for his errors, but I am glad you did not kill him. Please accept these potions of healing in reward for your wisdom in this matter. Are you ready for additional duties?
Go to the shrine in Maar Gan. Read the inscription on the rock and imitate Vivec's actions. If you have trouble, speak with the priest. He will assist you.
Have you chastised the False Incarnate?
Have you cleansed Hassour of the cultists?
Have you completed the Pilgrimage to Maar Gan?
Have you shown compassion to Bulfim gra-Shugarz?
I am sorry that you had to kill Elvil Vidron. Perhaps this will discourage others from making heretical claims.
I have heard that you are a False Incarnate. I am not yet convinced, but I no longer trust you.
I have heard that you are a False Incarnate. I am not yet convinced, but I no longer trust you.
I have heard that you are a False Incarnate. I am not yet convinced, but I no longer trust you.
I have heard that YOU are a False Incarnate. I am not yet convinced, but I no longer trust you. Like Elvil Vidron, if your claim is true, you must prove it to Archcanon Saryoni in Vivec.
I have no more duties for you. Speak with Uvoo Llaren in Ghostgate or Endryn Llethan in Vivec. Thank you for all you have done.
If you killed the Daedra at the shrine before taunting him, you must wait for his body to reform. Go back, taunt him into attacking, and then pray at the shrine.

It is on the north shore of Lake Masobi, in the northwest corner of the Ascadian Isles. You can get there by going east from Pelagiad and around the north side of the Dren Plantation, following the roads east until you reach Suran, or you can take a Silt Strider from Molag Mar or Vivec.
Seek the Orc called Bulfim gra-Shugarz at the Maelkashishi Shrine. Cure her and learn the meaning of compassion. And if at all possible, return the potion which I have entrusted to your care.

Speak with me again when you have proven yourself in the Temple. I have one more thing to ask of you, but you are not ready. Until then, speak with Uvoo Llaren in Ghostgate or Endryn Llethan in Vivec.

There is a dark cult dwelling in Hassour. Go to Hassour and bring the Tribunal's justice to the leader of this cult, Dagoth Fovon. Be warned, %PCRank, that Dagoth Fovon is a terrible foe. You may wish to fight more of the lesser servants of the Sixth House before taking on Dagoth Fovon. Many of the righteous have fallen to him. To get to Hassour, go to Balmora, then head east towards Moonmoth Legion Fort. When you enter the Foyada Mamaea, follow it all the way south.

There is a dark cult dwelling in Hassour. Go to Hassour and bring the Tribunal's justice to the leader of this cult, Dagoth Fovon. To get to Hassour, go to Balmora, then head east towards Moonmoth Legion Fort. When you enter the Foyada Mamaea, follow it all the way south.
To belong to the Temple is to practice compassion.
To demonstrate your faith, you must make the Pilgrimage to Maar Gan.

Travel to Ald Velothi and head east past the Daedric ruin of Ashalmawia. Continue due east until you reach the mountains. Then follow the trails south until you see another Daedric ruin. Be careful in Maelkashishi, %PCName. The followers of Sheogorath are unpredictable. Don't go further into the ruins than you must.
Unfortunate. But its use promoted a virtuous act. Well done, %PCName. Are you ready for further duties?

Vivec often showed compassion to his enemies. You must show compassion by curing Bulfim gra-Shugarz, a Sheogorath worshipper in Maelkashishi. Take this potion of cure blight. You can cure Bulfim by giving her the potion... But it is expensive. I would prefer you learned a spell such as 'Rilm's Gift' and returned the potion to me.
Where is it? Oh, I see. You are joking.
You already made the Pilgrimage to Maar Gan.
You cleansed the dark cult from Hassour.
You cured Bulfim gra-Shugharz and have proven your compassion. You might be interested in this book, which has an important lesson on the rewards of compassion. Were you able to preserve the potion?
You have already proven your compassion.

You have already sought out Hassour and cleansed the land of Dagoth Fovon? I am impressed, %PCName. Surely you do not need these scrolls and potions of cure blight, but take them anyway. As a gift from the Temple.
You have been expelled from the Temple, %PCName.
You have been expelled from the Temple.
You have been expelled from the Temple.
You have been expelled from the Temple.
You have performed beyond my expectations, %PCName. You are indeed resourceful as well as compassionate. Are you ready for further duties?
You have slain Bulfim gra-Shugharz?! You were to cure her -- not kill her! Perhaps you are not suited for the Temple.
You have slain Dagoth Fovon and cleansed the dark cult from Hassour. As these cultists sometimes spread Blight diseases, perhaps you can make use of these scrolls and potions.
You made the Pilgrimage to Maar Gan? It sounds like you handled Anhaedra well. Since you have learned another of Vivec's lessons, please take this book as a gift.
You put an end to the heresies of the False Incarnate.
Do you want to offer me a gift, outlander? Then bring me a kwama egg, for I am hungry.
More kwama egg? No, outlander. You are too generous. Keep it for yourself.
More kwama egg? No, outlander. You are too generous. Keep it for yourself.
You have a kwama egg for me? These are quite tasty. And not so easy to get. Thank you.
You have a kwama egg for me? These are quite tasty. And not so easy to get. Thank you.
Go away. I do not wish to soil my yurt with your blood.
I am the ashkhan of the Erabenimsun. You are a fool if you do not know that.
I have nothing to say to you. I despise you and your kind. Go away.
Very well. This problem has an easy solution.
What do you want, outlander?
You are stupid, outlander.
You are the outlander who claims to fulfill the Nerevarine prophecies. What do you want?
You have slain one of my people. You must pay with your life.

You want me to name you Erabenimsun Nerevarine? I would rather name you '%PCName Guar-Dung.' You are a hound. I despise you for a foreign fool, as do all my loyal gulakhans. The only honor I will show you is to kill you with my own hand if you ever trouble me again. Leave my sight, now, while you can.
%PCName! Thank you so much for saving me.
%PCName! They trapped me down here, and threatened to kill me! Are you sure you got them all?
Do you have the bittergreen petals?
Even though the Spriggans are gone, we still can't cut down this grove of trees.
Great. I'll take these and see what I can do. There's nothing more that you can do right now
column12: why don't you let the boss know things are taken care of?

column11: Hello, %PCName.
Hello, %PCName.

Hey, %PCName. Nice work with those Spriggans. We can get to the trees now for sure, but we still won't be able to cut them down. I tried explaining it once already, but they won't listen - something's not right with this grove.
Hi, %PCName. I'm still waiting on those Bittergreen petals so I can take care of these roots.
I'll need more than what you have. Make sure you've got at least five of them, or it won't be enough to have an effect.
It's all taken care of, thanks to you.
No? I think that might be what we're looking for, though. And if I could see them, perhaps I could figure a way out of this mess.
Not much we can do about the grove of trees unless we can get at the roots, %PCName.
Okay! Now we're getting somewhere. Lead on, %PCName.
Really? That sounds like what I'm looking for. Can you take me to see them?

Some sort of magical heebie-jeebie, that'd be my guess. Either way, we can't start on the building orders until those trees are gone. Maybe if we could get at the roots or something, but we'd have to do that from underground...
Sorry, %PCName, but as far as I'm concerned, I'm off duty as long as those Spriggans are out there.
There's no way we can cut those trees down as they are now. We could weaken them maybe if we could get at the roots, but they're probably too far underground to do anything from here.
They should soon be weak enough that we can cut them down - thanks to you, of course.

They've got to be way underground; too far down for us to dig to. They're probably as tough as the trees themselves, so anyone that ran into them would know it. I'd ask the workers in the mine about it, but... well, you know. It's dark down there.
This sure looks like the place. These roots probably extend all the way up to those trees at the surface.
Unless we have access to the roots of the trees, there's little chance we can bring them down.
We'll need to weaken the roots. Then we might be able to cut the trees down.

Well, if this is the right place, maybe there's something I can do about it. If these roots are drinking from this pool of water, we can try poisoning the water to weaken them. If they're weakened, the trees might fall. But I'd need some bittergreen petals.... Can you get some for me? I'll need at least five of them. I doubt you'll find any on Solstheim, but you can probably dredge them up someplace more civilized.
Well, let me know when you've got them. We can't proceed until we do something about this.
Where are they? I don't see any.
You just take me to wherever they are. I'll figure out how to handle it once we get there.
You're going to show me where the roots are, right?
Do you want me to stay with you? I'd be willing to wait here. I m-mean, it's up to you.
Hello. I'm told you will accompany me to the Shrine of the Dead and protect me as we travel together. Our Lady commands it...so I suppose we must go.
I am attempting to cleanse the Shrine. Please, don't interrupt me.
I will now cleanse the Shrine of the Dead, I suppose. If I can. Be with me, Lady.

I-I'd rather not speak of it. I know what must be done, but the place frightens me to the core. I don't know why I was chosen, but Our Lady believes I must be the one to go, as the shrine must be cleansed.
I'm glad all that's over.
It is done. Please, can we return to the Temple now?
It seems we've done our job. The Shrine is cleansed.
It seems we've done our job. The Shrine is cleansed.
Oh...hello. Have we met? I'm Urvel Dulni, a recent Initiate here at the Temple.
Oh...hello. Have we met? I'm Urvel Dulni, a recent Initiate here at the Temple.
Oh...if you insist. I mean, if you're completely sure....
Really? Excellent! I mean...I wouldn't want to get in the way. You understand. I'll guard your back from here.
Yes? M-must we travel together? Or may I wait here? Or go home? Please?
You have killed the Profane? Please take me to the Shrine of the Dead.
Fine. It's just a filthy lizard, anyway, nothing to get upset about. We'll leave him alone. Go on. Get out, before we change our minds.
Fine. It's just a filthy lizard, anyway, nothing to get upset about. We'll leave him alone. Go on. Get out, before we change our minds.
Get out of our way, n'wah. We got issues with this filthy lizard here.
His kind aren't welcome here. He belongs in the swamp with the rest of them.
I don't care, n'wah. Just leave me alone.
I don't care. They leave me alone, I leave them alone.
I said... leave me alone.
If you don't get lost, I'm gonna hit you AND that filthy lizard so hard that when you finally hit the ground, your clothes'll be outta style.
Just leave me alone, n'wah.
Look. Just leave me alone.
Okay, okay. He's just a filthy lizard. He can't help it. I'll leave him alone.
Whatever you say, pilgrim. Just let it ride. We'll leave him alone.
%PCName! What are you doing here? Uh... there's a perfectly good explanation for this, I assure you...
Ahem.... Uhh, %PCName? Carnius wants to see you. You know, about that job.... the one that you were doing. You should let him know it's done. Okay? Great.
Aldam is dead? That's not what I signed on for... this is getting out of hand. The deal is off.
Good work. Better go see Carnuis.
He's the boss. Tough guy, but what people say about him isn't all true. Really. I mean, why would I say anything bad about him?
Hey there, %PCName. What are you doing here?
Hey.... Why do you keep looking at me like that?
Hi there, %PCName. Thanks for helping out.
I know you're here to help, but someone killed the guard. That'll draw way too much attention to the mine, and maybe to me. No way. I'm not doing it.
I'm not making a move until you distract the guard.
I'm telling you, Carnius made me do it! Go ask him, if you don't believe me!

It should be a pretty simple task, really. I know that Aldam has a fondness for whiskey. Give this to him, and he should be out of the way long enough for me to do my job. Stay close to him; it's important that we're not seen together until the job is all done. I'll come find you once I've got my hands on the ore. Okay, I'm going to head down near the storeroom.
Just give him that whiskey I handed you, %PCName. That should occupy him.
Nice work. This will put him in a tough position; even if he does realize what happened, he won't be able to do anything about it, because that'll mean admitting he was drinking on the job.
Oh, uhh.... hey there, %PCName. Didn't see you. Excuse me, but I need to, uhh, get back to work.
So, you're here to help, are you? Well, I need you to distract the guard.
Thanks for covering for me, %PCName.
That's me.
What are you doing? Stay close to the guard - I'll come to you when I'm done.
Yes, yes! You see, I... well, I was... okay, fine. You caught me. But I swear, I didn't want to do this! Carnius put me up to it - he said he'd kill me if I didn't steal as much ore as I could!
You're not going to get me in trouble, right? You heard my explanation - it was all Carnius' idea!

That is what we are, and what we will always be. We live apart from the clans: Aundae, Berne, and Quarra. They will not accept us into their fold, so we live under the ground, surfacing to prey on the warmbloods that live above. Though the clans shun us, we are powerful, and have very few weaknesses.

That is what we are, and what we will always be. We live apart from the clans: Aundae, Berne, and Quarra. They will not accept us into their fold, so we live under the ground, surfacing to prey on the warmbloods that live above. Though the clans shun us, we are powerful, and have very few weaknesses.

That is what we are, and what we will always be. We live apart from the clans: Aundae, Berne, and Quarra. They will not accept us into their fold, so we live under the ground, surfacing to prey on the warmbloods that live above. Though the clans shun us, we are powerful, and have very few weaknesses.

That is what we are, and what we will always be. We live apart from the clans: Aundae, Berne, and Quarra. They will not accept us into their fold, so we live under the ground, surfacing to prey on the warmbloods that live above. Though the clans shun us, we are powerful, and have very few weaknesses.

That is what we are, and what we will always be. We live apart from the clans: Aundae, Berne, and Quarra. They will not accept us into their fold, so we live under the ground, surfacing to prey on the warmbloods that live above. Though the clans shun us, we are powerful, and have very few weaknesses.
Master Neloth is right here.
Did my father send you? Are you here to rescue me? Should we travel together back to Sarethi Manor?
Do you want me to wait here?
He is the one who had me secretly arrested. I think he was going to use me against my father. I'd stay away from him if I were you.
I am feeling much better now that the ash statue is gone.
I am sorry. I am not feeling well. What can I do for you?
I couldn't remember before, but now I know where I got the statue. I got it from Galtis Guvron at The Rat in the Pot.
I couldn't remember before, but now I know where I got the statue. I got it from Galtis Guvron at The Rat in the Pot.
I didn't kill him. He was my closest friend. The guards found me near his body, but I don't remember anything that happened that night. Sometimes, though, sometimes I have... bad dreams.
I feel as if this was all my fault, but at least the ash statue is gone. I know I won't do anything like that again. Oh, I think I remember where I got that ash statue...
I haven't had any bad dreams since I spoke with Lloros Sarano.
I remember what you did for me when I was in trouble.

I was having bad dreams even before Bralen Carvaren died... It seems like they started when I got that ash statue. Maybe if you take the statue away, the dreams will stop. Maybe I should talk to one of the priests at the Temple.
I will go see Lloros Sarano as soon as I can.
I'll wait right here.
I'm glad it's all over.
I'm Varvur, what do you need?
I'm Varvur. Did my father send you? Can we get out of here and travel together to Sarethi Manor?
Lloros Sarano wants to speak with me about the ash statue? Maybe he can do something about these bad dreams. I will see him as soon as I can.
Shall we travel back to my father, Athyn Sarethi?

Sometimes I kill Bralen Carvaren in my dreams. It's... horrible. But that doesn't mean I killed him, does it? I was having bad dreams before Bralen Carvaren died. About the time I got that ash statue. It's right over there. Maybe if you take it away the bad dreams will stop.

Sometimes I kill Bralen Carvaren in my dreams. It's... horrible. But that doesn't mean I killed him, does it? I was having bad dreams before Bralen Carvaren died. About the time I got that ash statue. Look for it in my room in the Guard Quarters here. Maybe if you take it away, the bad dreams will stop.
Sorry, but I must stay here in Sarethi Manor until I am feeling better.
Take me back to my father, Athyn Sarethi.
Take me to my father in Sarethi Manor.
Talk to my father, Athyn Sarethi.
Yes, we travel together back to Sarethi Manor.
Ah, you have a miner's pick. I'll let you in so you can work. They're still working on the north side I think. Anyway, here's the key.
I already gave you the key, now get lost before they see us talking.
I'm not supposed to let anyone in. But, you're not so bad. Here, take the key, but don't tell Darius I gave it to you.
It's locked and yes, I have the key. If I liked you more, maybe I'd let you in.
It's locked. Yes, I have the key. No you can't have it. I don't care who you are. Darius says no one goes in but the workers.
Since you're in the Legion, here's the key. Be careful.
She works here in the library. If she's not here right now, you might find her in her private quarters. Her door is across from the Canon Offices here in the Hall of Wisdom.
I have nothing to say. You want to talk, talk to Varis.

What could kill two Ordinators before they can draw their weapons? Slit their throats? Happened right here in Vivec. Must be a sorcerer or vampire. The Office of the Watch in the Hall of Justice is worried about sending their own Ordinators out after this killer. The rumor is that the Office of the Watch is looking for outside help. You're an outlander. Did you know five other outlanders were killed just the same way?
Nah. I'm not interested in tanglin' with the Goldies. Get me nice clothes all fussed. And maybe an artery or two. Not a smart move.
No. I dint do it. I dint do nuthin'. I was framed. I wasn't nowhere near the place. And what would I be doin', working on them silly pilgrims? Ain't worth the sweat, the tight little prigs.

You know. God-grubbers, rubbin' themselves where the saints have trod and all that. Got jack-all. Give it all to the Temple, the fools. Dressed in bags and sacks. Sour, pinch-coin altar-lickers. Make me puke.
About damn time. Here, here's your payment. Now get out of here.
Tell him I'd be willing to business with him again some time.
The slave died on the way? Damn. Did you get the shipment from her? The moon sugar she was carrying in her was worth a fortune. I can't abide someone else taking Vorar's moon sugar.

Yes, this slave was his final payment to me...or rather what she was carrying. All that moon sugar he had her swallow will fetch me a good price. Thank you for your help in delivering the shipment. Here, take this.
You don't have it? You're starting to bother me, %PCRace.
You must be the one Relam Arinith sent.
Again, hello, %PCName. Bless and be blessed.
Again, hello, %PCName. Bless and be blessed.
Ah. You understand me a bit, yes? Hello, %PCName. Yakum greet you. Bless and be blessed. Speak Old Elf, yes, so Yakum learn. You know Ashlanders, yes, a little. Yakum is Ashlander.
Ah. You understand me a bit, yes? Hello, %PCName. Yakum greet you. Bless and be blessed. Speak Old Elf, yes, so Yakum learn. You know Ashlanders, yes, a little. Yakum is Ashlander.
Hello. Yakum. Speak Ashland. Old Elf, not so good speak.
No more dust from Red Mountain. No more bad dreams. Yes?

There is bad magic in the dust from Red Mountain. The grass dies, the kwama and guar go mad, bite and fight. These are very hard times for the tribes, so the tribes go raiding. Here there is not blight, and I live in big house and get rich and soft like a fat trader.

There's bad magic in the dust from Red Mountain. The Sharmat Dagoth Ur sends bad dreams in the dust. The people can't sleep, act crazy. When the blight storms come, soul sickness comes -- both together. When I lived in the ashlands, I got no sleep had bad dreams, was all the time tired. Now that I'm here in Pelagiad, I sleep fine.

We are the People of the Wastes. We hunt and herd guar. We live the Law and honor the Ancestors. No houses. Just yurts. I was a herder, but now I want to become rich, like a great trader. I will live in a town, fight, find treasure, get rich, learn to trade. The soul sickness and blight storms are very bad now in the Ashlands, so I came to Pelagiad. Now I live in a big house and work for men who pay gold.
What. Yakum. Me? Speak Ashland. Not speak so good Old Elf. Sorry?
Outlander. You'll find no welcome here, I'm afraid.
We know about the prophecies. Our ashkhan and gulakhans say they are foolish superstition. There will be trouble if you speak with them. Perhaps you should speak to our wise woman, Manirai.

We were told these prophecies were foolish superstition. But you have made many changes here. Now we think, maybe these are not foolish superstition. Maybe you are something special. Maybe we can hope for something better.
You are the outlander who claims to be the Nerevarine? You'll find no welcome here, I'm afraid.

You have slain one of the peace-loving Erabenimsun. You deserve to die. Though we have no champion to bring us justice, we still have our pride. We will not treat with you, even though you threaten to murder us, too.
If you have come to steal, we have nothing, outlander. If you have come to fight, then kill us, and be done with it.
If you have come to steal, we have nothing, outlander. If you have come to fight, then kill us, and be done with it. But if you are the Nerevarine, please, find a safe place for the Ahemmusa.
Mamaea is our healer. You'll find her in her tent.
Our trader, Lanabi, has her yurt with the ashkhan's and the gulakhan's yurts.
Please. Do not speak to me about prophecies. We need help right now.
Some say you are the Nerevarine. I hope that is true, and that you can find us a safe place.
Speak to the wise woman, Sinnammu Mirpal. She is our leader.
Thank you, %PCName. You have made a safe place for the Ahemmusa. You have our gratitude, and our support.
Thank you, %PCName. You have made a safe place for the Ahemmusa. You have our gratitude, and our support.

We are the Ahemmusa. And we will be the last of the Ahemmusa, if we do not find a safe place. The blight kills our game, our herds, our hunters and herders. We cannot protect ourselves from the blight-sick animals or blight monsters. If you can help us, please speak to our wise woman, Sinnammu Mirpal.

We need a place to go where our herds and people can be safe from the blight and blight monsters. For us, it is a matter of life and death. We hope some happy day the Nerevarine of prophecy will defeat Dagoth Ur, and cast down the false gods, and the blight will be gone, and there will be no more sick animals or monsters, and we can live here in peace. But if we do not find a safe place now, we will not survive to see that happy day.
You have made Ald Daedroth a safe refuge for the Ahemmusa. Thank you, %PCName.

All of that may be true, and I'm sure you think it is very important, but it has nothing to do with us -- at least, not the way you tell it. I'm sorry, but I will not let you bother Sul-Matuul or Nibani Maesa with all this.
Among my people, I am accounted brave and able. But I would not go there. These are tales to be told to my sons, and the sons of my sons.
Challenge me, if you are not afraid.
Challenge me, if you are not afraid.
Challenge me. The gift I want from you is your blood.
Challenge me. The gift I want from you is your blood.

Go and speak to Sul-Matuul. You have earned the right. Speak with respect, and say you have bested his gulakhan in ritual challenge. His yurt is the central one in the group of five yurts beneath one awning.
Go to Sul-Matuul's yurt. Tell him that Zabamund has sent you to speak to him.
Hah. Perhaps if you HAD 200 good coins, then perhaps it would be a worthy tribute. But you do not. As it is, you shall not speak to Sul-Matuul or Nibani Maesa.

Hmm. I know not what to make of your deeds. Your words may be more worthy than your deeds. But you are well-spoken, and you do tell a pretty tale. Perhaps Sul-Matuul will be angry with me. But I think I can bear that. Go to the Ashkhan's Yurt and speak with Sul-Matuul. Ask him your questions, and tell him I have sent you.

Hmm. These are not simple matters. You know a great deal more than I would have thought. And some of what you say is news to me. I believe you should speak to Sul-Matuul. Perhaps he will be angry with me. But I think I can bear that. Go to the Ashkhan's Yurt and speak with Sul-Matuul. Ask him your questions, and tell him I have sent you.
I still can't believe it. An outlander.... But you are an outlander no more, %PCName. You came to us as an outlander, according to prophecy. But now you are one of us.
I will not listen. I will only hear your word of challenge.
I will not listen. I will only hear your word of challenge.
It is our custom. Among strangers, we honor this custom with gold.
It is strange to hear an outlander claim the signs of prophecy. Stranger still to hear an outlander speak of Nerevar Moon-and-Star, and ask to be tested. Very strange.
Perhaps it is not your fault. But your talk does not interest me.
Sul-Matuul will not talk to you. Nibani Maesa will not talk to you. You have no standing among us, outlander.
Surely we are living in the greatest days of the world. I can only hope we will survive them, and tell these stories again and again, when Dagoth Ur is defeated.
Talk, outlander. Speak with respect, and I will listen.
The Nerevarine Prophecies are not for outlanders. Why should Sul-Matuul and Nibani Maesa speak to you about these things? Who are you, that we should trust you?
The only talk I wish to hear, killer of my kin, is the talk of challenge.
The only talk I wish to hear, killer of my kin, is the talk of challenge.

These are indeed worthy deeds. I hear the truth in your words. Perhaps Sul-Matuul will be angry with me. But I think I can bear that. Go to the Ashkhan's Yurt and speak with Sul-Matuul. Ask him your questions, and tell him I have sent you.
Welcome, %PCName. Hearth and hand are yours.
Welcome, %PCName. They say your words and deeds have pleased our chief and wise woman.

Welcome, clanfriend. Nibani Maesa has told me that she thinks you may be the Nerevarine, and that she has promised to counsel you. There is little that can surprise me. But Nibani Maesa is no one's fool. You will find her in her yurt.

Yes, a gift of 200 gold coins. That is an earnest proof of your respect. Yes, I believe you should speak to our ashkhan. Perhaps he will be angry with me. But I think I can bear that. Go to the Ashkhan's Yurt and speak with Sul-Matuul. Ask him your questions, and tell him I have sent you.
You are a mere stripling. I might win as much honor by killing a dog. You shall not speak to Sul-Matuul or Nibani Maesa.

You are not an unworthy opponent. I hear honor in your words, and courage in your heart. I would regret killing you. But regret even more should you kill me. Very well. Perhaps Sul-Matuul will be angry with me. But I think I can bear that. Go to the Ashkhan's Yurt and speak with Sul-Matuul. Ask him your questions, and tell him I have sent you.
You have killed the ashkhan Sul-Matuul. There can be no forgiveness. Leave. I have no more words for you.
You have killed the wise woman Nibani Maesa. There can be no forgiveness. Leave. I have no more words for you.

You have no standing among us, outlander. But you speak well, and with respect. So I will explain. It is against our customs that an outlander should speak to an ashkhan or wise woman. I'll tell you, also, that Sul-Matuul has no love for outlanders.
You think well of yourself. But I do not share your opinion. You shall not speak to Sul-Matuul or Nibani Maesa.
